author: Russell B Sprague
title: Do Not Buy This Product
content:
I purchased and installed this device, set up the software and let it run. I thought that all was well. Then, I decided to look at my files on the drive just to make sure that things were operating as planned.

Big surprise!!! The files were formatted with a .bkup extension; not a jpeg or an mp3 anywhere. In addition the many hundred folders were suddenly about fifty files with unknowable files names of about 20, or so, letters and numbers.

I researched to find a way to open these files, hoping that I could salvage my purchase. The only answer I was able to find was fvp.exe, at a cost of $40.

So, are my files backed up? Technically, yes. Can I retrieve and use those files if my computer has a problem? No f_____ way. The Amazon presentation of this product was incomplete and mis-leading. Shame on them.

author: TJTomato
title: Could not get it to work from the start
content: Downloaded software several times and spent hours trying to get it to work without success!  Returned and very frustrated.

author: Daniel Herring
title: Excellent
content:
This item works perfect!! I transferred approx. 200GB of data and it took about an hour to write all the files to the hard drive. This drive is very fast, especially with the USB 3.0. I am so happy that I bought this item. I used a $20 256gb flash drive before using this item and it produced corrupted files and error messages. However, with this hard drive I experienced no problems at all. I highly recommend this item if you are looking for an external hard drive.

Note: The toshiba backup software sucks so I just used copy and paste.

author: Phillip J. Klein
title: Turns a laptop into a giant.
content:
I bought a laptop computer that only came with a 90 GB drive.  By the time you load the operating system and a bunch of applications, the available disk space becomes pretty sparse.  I now use this for all my music and photo files.  The device gets its power from the laptop over the USB cable and the speed is amazingly fast.  If I want, I can connect this drive to my desktop PC when I want to edit photos on a big screen.
After using this, I hardly ever think about using USB memory sticks.

author: A. Garrison
title: Good drive. Excellent value for the price!
content: I've purchased several of these, and I haven't had a single problem with any of them. I like the USB 3.0 connection, particularly for transferring large files. My only complaint, and this is VERY minor, is that the top of the drive is slightly convex, so you can't stack them on top of each other. It really doesn't even affect me, because I line up all my drives vertically on edge using small notecard/mail sorters to hold them.

author: securetransint
title: NOT compatible with High Sierra Operating System
content:
If you have updated to High Sierra for the macOS DON'T BUY.
It will not mount and is only compatible with Sierra and all other operating systems prior.
Does not say that on the description.

author: newbie
title: Great price, great product
content: Easy to use and set up you can partition the drive.  Very portable and small considering the capacity-- nice way to back up important files in case you have to crash your computer or it is crashed for you.

author: Jennie
title: great item
content:
Saved a lot of space for my computer, as a graphic designer, I need something like this to save my images and designing.
great price and good quality.

author: macreato
title: THE BEST
content: This is the BEST external hard drive that I have ever used.  After discovering this small hd I dont see a need for thumb drives, seriously.  I have them all over the house, yet I could have simply used this ONE.  It is already partitioned into categories which makes it so easy to to store info on AND  to retrieve.  Small, user friendly, affordable.

author: Jean Sebastian
title: Works for xbox and ps
content: La calidad del disco duro es muy buena. Compré 2 de estos para mi consola xbox one y play station 4. Funcionan perfectamente y son muy fáciles de instalar. Lo malo es que como tal el disco duro no tiene una base donde sostenerse, o por así decirlo, soportes de mesa en las esquinas para que no se raye el producto.

author: Stacie in Seattle
title: crashes fro no reason
content: Ive done exactly one back up on this drive and saved some videos. 45 days later went to save some more files on it and got a pop up saying drive was defective and needed to be reformatted and lost all the stuff I just saved to it. waste of money

author: Salena
title: Disappointing.
content: I bought this (in red) towards the end on January for some classes that required us to download large files. I read the 1 star reviews and hoped that I wouldn't be one of the unlucky ones.  With my luck, the hard drive decided to die mid-April on a morning  consisting of 2 exams... along with all of my notes. What is the point of purchasing something than can't even last a semester? Why should we have to be paranoid about losing our data? Getting a better product for a few more bucks is better than the frustration of dealing with a waste of 50 dollars.

author: Mr. James
title: Nice protection at a fair price.
content:
I am very satisfied with this Toshiba portable hard drive.  Bought it for the sole purpose of backing up my Samsung 1TB computer.  Plugged it in via USB and all the installation instructions were easy to followed on my computer.  I bought the 3 TB at a nice price, with no hitches with the backup process and now feel a bit of comfort knowing that my files are safer.  This drive works with both 2.0 and 3.0 USB ports, obviously will download faster if you use a 3.0 hub.  My computer is 5 years old and I thought my USB ports were probably all 2.0 but turns out, I had one 3.0 USB so always good to check.  One tip is that 3.0 USB ports are blue in the female inside part of your computer.  So if you are not sure, check it out.  It does come with the necessary USB cable, 21 inches in length and a very limited instruction pamphlet.  The unit itself is very sleek looking, polished black that will show fingerprint smudges but small enough to wipe clean fairly easily.  Dimensions of the drive are 3" x 4" length and width and the thickness of the unit is 3/4 inches in depth, so a bit larger that a deck of paying cards.

This is an HDD (Hard Disk Drive) so I guess another decision for shoppers will be in deciding between either a Solid State Drive (SSD) or Hard Disk Drive (HDD).  If processing and overall speed of the external unit is key or if you are into gaming or audio or video production, you may want to consider the more efficient, faster and more expensive SSD Drives (solid state) that are out there.  Just saying that there are faster drives on the market but you will pay for it.  For my purposes, this Toshiba HDD is exactly what I needed at a reasonable price.

When powered up and on, there is a small, round blue Led light located on the front upper front of the unit.

author: Paul R. Jackel
title: Don't buy this piece of junk!
content: I bought this Toshiba Canvio Advance 2TB Portable External Hard Drive USB 3.0 in December , 2018 to back up the hard drive on my home computer. Within four months it broke down and was no longer functioning. Not much I can do at this point except to warn others to not make the same mistake I did and purchase this piece of junk. I won't be buying any Toshiba products from now on.

author: Mika
title: Works as needed, satisfied with purchase.
content: I only gave tech support a 3 star rating because I haven't needed to use it. I bought this for school as an animation student. Works well for what I need it for, which is storing classwork and projects since I work on them on multiple computers. Haven't had any issues, and it's password protected just in case it gets lost or stolen. Love it!

author: Emma Jorgensen
title: DO NOT ORDER - LOST EVERYTHING
content: I got both the 2 TB and 4 TB hard drive and the 4 TB drive broke in less than a month and I had to go through data recovery. TODAY my 2 TB hard drive did the same thing and it's only 4 months old. This pisses me off that a company is okay selling faulty equipment the fact that both of mine crapped out shows that it's not just a defect. the product just sucks and should never be used or bought. if you want a hard drive that makes you lose your stuff then, by all means, buy it.

author: L. Wolff
title: Love it!
content: I'm so relieved that I finally broke down and bought a portable hard drive. I've wanted my own "cloud" and since I bought a new laptop I needed to set up a new backup system. I'm really bad at remembering so I chose this one as I can set a reminder! It's super easy to set up and transfer files. I do use OneDrive, but I worry about security of some of my documents. I have removed them from Onedrive and now I can have them safely stored on this device.

author: Ken
title: Simple for Windows 10
content:
Simple to use and compatible with Windows 10.  It comes with a USB cable.  Once plugged in, without downloading it's software, it was recognized as a drive in "My Computer"  and "File Manager."  Therefore, I could simply start dragging files there instantly.

I then downloaded the software, by clicking its .exe file, and prompted for registration etc.

I opted to tell it what to back-up, and I will do it manually.  It takes a couple hours to back up 38 Gig the 1st time.

...or you could use it to back up your entire computer or operating system.

An added benefit is the USB cable also fits a Samsung Galaxy 5, so unplug your drive and plug in your phone to transfer phots etc using Kies3 etc.  ...or your phone shows up as a drive.

An added plus is that the other end of the USB cable fits my Galaxy 5 phone.  So I can sync my phone to my main computer by disconnectin the new drive for a few minites, without searching for another cable!

author: Janet S. Stone
title: Great product - easy set up - helped me store excess on my laptop hard drive
content: Great product - very happy with having the extra storage space and not having to use all the silly small capacity flash drives - this is huge in space storage

author: Lisette Root
title: Confusing product
content: The directions for accessing my downloaded pictures was lacking. It may well have stored them, but if I can't access them, what good is that? More clear directions are needed. If I can get directions sent to me from the manufacturer that are clear and easy to use, I will write a different review.

author: TechGuy56
title: Great backup drive
content: The Toshiba Canvio Advance  is a great drive, the included software installs easily and works well. This is definitely a very good choice for a backup drive. I used Velcro to attach it to the top of my laptop so it's always connected and convenient with no hassle. It would be great if they included strong Velcro with the unit for easy setup. It was definitely worth the price and I recommend it for backup usage.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A wonderful external hard drive :D
content: I love it so far! I read some of the reviews before ordering but some people had trouble with it working on both windows and mac and when formatting you’ll have to change some settings to make sure it works for both. I have to go back and forth on my hp to my school’s macs and this has been so helpful. Those who doesn’t know which setting, i took a tiny screenshot but this is when formatting on a windows. Idk about when you first set it up on a mac. Hope it helps. Overall i love this device :) I definitely recommend it! I got it in red(my favorite color) and got a matching case ❤️

author: YAH
title: but this was easy enough to use and can use with my Mac
content: I haven't tried other items, but this was easy enough to use and can use with my Mac. I have had it now for about 2 weeks. I am using it with USB 2.0 and it is very fast compared to Apple Time Capsule. It copies really quick even huge files or data.

author: Brianna Mancine
title: High Recommended
content: PERFECT! This external hard drive has made it perfectly fine through several drops and tumbles, where my last one died after one small tumble. I HIGHLY recommend this hard drive. Very fast and very nice.

author: Skipjack68

I am installing a new computer and I ordered this Toshiba Canvio Advance 2 TB port  Back-up drive because "it comes with Auto BACKUP SOFTWARE "  according to the sales page.  It DOES NOT come with the soft ware!!!!  "It does not Plug in and run!"  You have to down load THE BACK-UP SOFTWARE!  i WENT ON TOSHIBA WEB SITE TO DOWNLOAD! author: J. Cheng
title: Died In a Month
content: This drive basically sat on my desk and one day decided to make a clicking noise the next morning I turned on my computer and would not mount.  I bought data recovery and they couldn't even extract a KB off of it.  Very disappointing since Toshiba makes drives for so many computer companies.

author: Sr Davila
title: Llegó bien rápido pero me desepciono un poco
content: Al parece no es claro la presentación de la capacidad es de 1 Terá no de 3 como dice . Eso me hizo sentir engañado.

author: Roger M
title: Great Drive; Backup SW is very basic
content:
I purchased this drive to use as a backup drive for my desktop PC. The drive is very easy to install. It has been very durable so far. The USB 3.0 performance is as expected, and the drive is very quiet.
I give it 4 stars only because of the backup SW that is included. This SW is very basic, and doesn't allow the user any control over the backup. The SW supports only one backup job. It only performs incremental backups (I prefer differential backups), and it has no option to backup a system image. It does not have an option to encrypt the data with a passcode. This SW may be fine for most, but for users who want more control over their backup settings, I recommend using an advanced backup SW, such as BounceBack or Acronis.

author: Sean Ruffin
title: Good for awhile.
content: It has worked fine for PS4/Xbox one but after roughly two years it just stopped working, doesn't appear on PC/laptop/gaming consoles at all. It sucks since all the data I put on it is now gone.

author: Cristina
title: Failed on second day, how to return with my files copied on it???
content: My files from a desktop were copied on it after taking all day to copy.  (Way less than 1TB)  Then it failed to work.  Amazon keeps demanding that I send them the hard drive to get a refund which I will not do as it has my private work files on it and will not delete.  I will not accept this as an answer.

author: rre-58
title: works great
content: I have over 1000 movies on one.

author: Jane Wiseman
title: Bad product, terrible customer support
content: This product backed up my hard drive exactly once. Then it quit. To fix the problem, Customer support wants to charge me over half what I paid originally. I don’t intend to throw good money after bad, nor to return the thing after seeing I’d have to pay close to what I originally paid in shipping ( more than that in aggravation). You got me, Toshiba. I am giving this device two stars because I’m still using it to store files manually. Hope that doesn’t quit, too.in any case, once bitten, twice shy. I’ll no longer buy this company’s products.

author: puternerd
title: Design
content: The drive cable has a unique plug on drive side and USB on the end. This cable if lost or damaged may be hard to replace.

author: Henry Long
title: Seek an alternative storage method
content: I wish that I could recommend this drive--the concept is a great one...a 2.5" form factor drive with greater than 2TB for a great price--now, after transferring large quantities of important data to the drive, I'm unable to transfer any of the data I copied to the drive--it has several issues and I'm having to go through a data recovery process in the hopes that I can retrieve what I am unable to transfer normally. I've had the drive for about 2 weeks and have had constant issues. I can't recommend this drive and as soon as I am sure the data recovery is successful or not, I will be RMAing this drive for a refund. I have to admit, I was a bit surprised by such an immediate failure, as I've been happy with previous Toshiba storage devices, internal AND external.

author: whippetnipples
title: Rad
content: Holy smokes. I had a 1TB hard drive from the Jurassic period. That thing weighed 13 pounds and was the size of a brick. I used it as a weapon when it wasn't busy saving files. Finally the POS broke and I got this Toshiba. Hey, you guys, this thing is 2TB and, like, small. Wtf. It's rad.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love it!
content: I bought one 3TB and one 2TB.  They both came with pre-installed software.  You just plug it in and with a few clicks, everything gets backed up.  The backup itself took several hours for each computer, but it runs its course without your input.

author: LT
title: Glad I bought this
content: Amazon changed a flop into a good deal. Out of the box the device gave me an I/O error and failed operation on every file copy. I tried another usb 3 port, same result. I was in the process of returning it when I mentioned I bought this despite bad reviews due to decades of good experiences with Toshiba products and to upgrade my Canvio 500 gb which was still working great. That's when I thought to try that old Canvio's cable and voila, it worked copying a 33gb with zero errors, then two more smaller incremental backup files. And Amazon gave me a credit for the bad cable when I found I could buy a replacement on Amazon and get it the next day. So instead of swapping a defective product for another one Amazon suggested a deal that was faster and cost less for both of us. Toshiba support on the other hand wouldn't answer the phone for Amazon as we worked to resolve the problem. So kudos Amazon and raspberries to Toshiba support.

author: Trancelucence
title: Shiny HIGH gloss drive
content: I've owned many external hard drives, nearly every one has failed, except the half dozen Toshiba drives I've owned.  Other brands have failed internally, others through mishaps or rough handling, my bad, but not Toshibas, ever, the only brand for me.  I'm leaving a review though to say that I was surprised to find this red drive has a beautiful, polished dark-ish candy apple red finish.  I couldn't tell from the photos that it has a high gloss finish, much preferred to boring matte drives, love it.  Ultra-fast, too, perfect.  Highest recommendation.

author: Brian
title: Free security and backup software downloads
content: This is a good quality company that makes quality products.  I got this 2TB external Hard-drive for just over 50$, and it is from a name brand.  It comes with a free download of both security software (allowing for the created of a password secured partition equivalent of a bank vault, and backup software.  All of that for a huge quality external HD and it only cost me just over 50$.  I would say that that is an outstanding deal!

author: Jen Chang
title: Scratches easily
content: I bought this because I needed a new one. I used it once and the second time I went to back up my files I noticed a bunch of scratches on this thing. It scratches so easily. I wish I knew before I bought it so that I could have bought a screen protector for it because now it looks ugly.

author: Michael E. Lantz
title: As a basic backup storage--works as advertised.
content: The Canvio Connect II was just as advertized--I plugged it into the USB port and the drive directory showed up in Windows File Explorer.  Drag and drop full directories onto it and copied no problem.  I haven't used it for very long so can't testify to its endurance, nor have I used any other advanced features.

author: Peter Pan
title: Recommend
content: after format to Exfat, I will its capacity is 3.9TB

author: Blingus
title: Fast, cute, convenient!
content: I've used this little guy every day for a month now, and I am extremely happy with its performance. The white LED in the upper corner is helpful to determine whether it's active or safe to disconnect, but it's not too bright or distracting. I think this drive is a good value for the money. It allowed me to clear a lot of space on my aging iMac's internal hard drive, and doing so has made audio editing and other cache-eating operations much faster.

author: James Flippin
title: Junk. Died within two months of light use.
content: I've had several portable HD's over the years, but this is the first one I consider to have been junk. Worked fine, then all of a sudden it started having flaky connection issues. Then it died altogether and won't even power on. Less than two months of light use as a backup device.

author: Joseph K.
title: Need to consider the software
content:
Very nice colour ever.
design is so cool. I am sure you will be pushed by yourself to go to a caffe with this portable HDD.

The speed of data transmiting is good.

but one point. I am using Macbook pro and Windows laptop at the same time.
Due to the format of harddrive. You must choose ExFAT format to us for both of them.

NTFS for Mac is no longer available for this Canvio Advance.
without it, I am recommending this one.

author: Mark Richardson
title: but experience in trying to make it serve that function was not good.
content: Works well as an external drive for my laptop, but I bought at as a network drive for my router, and could not make it serve that function. It installed but would not show up on the network, despite a couple of hours on the phone with my ISP tech support.  Software loaded on the drive would not work. Might have been by ignorance of how to set up a network drive, but experience in trying to make it serve that function was not good.

author: Kacey
title: Peace of mind
content: Spending a little money to have peace of mind that my files are backed up goes a long way for a graduate student! The Toshiba Portable HD is convenient, easy to use, and can back up your computer in addition to holding other files. With 1TB of storage, I'm not concerned about not having enough space for my files. This is a must for any college student or someone in the workforce looking to backup their files!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good first impression
content:
So far so good. I needed something to store images and photoshop/ illustrator files and this was SUPER easy to install.
New laptop..  Backed up my images and current adobe files in about a second because I don’t have much yet.

4 stars just because I received it today and can’t speak for it’s overall performance quite yet.

author: Sasha
title: Unable to Make This Work to Create a Full Backup, Several Attempts
content: I wanted to love this Toshiba device but simply can't recommend it, possibly due to the third party software. I purchased it last year and have tried to back up my system several times since. Each time I encounter a problem that's frustrating and seemingly unsolvable. Once you run through the setup (NTI Backup Now EZ 4) there seems to be no way to change the settings - keeps saying the system is using the device so it can't be changed. There are also very few options in settings, nothing seems to apply. I have gone to the software publisher's site several times (NTI) for update and even the download options are not clear. I'm in the software industry so like to think I have a pretty good handle on software usability and troubleshooting, but I just can't make this thing for me. :-(

author: Jessica
title: Faulty!!! DO NOT BUY
content: This drive disconnects constantly. I've tried changing cords but it just keeps happening. I'm not able to back up my computer because it will not stay connected. My return window closed and now I'm SOL.

author: Samuel Levi
title: Be inspired by your life
content: This is really useful and lightweight. It is so small it fits in the palm of your ✋. It's also very fast and quiet. It has a beautiful surface finish as well. It's sleek and modern. I use it to backup my DSLR camera. I would give it 10 stars if I could.

author: Aaron
title: Fast and plenty of space
content: Great high capacity storage that is backwards compatible with USB 2.0. Can be formatted to your needs. I've used one for a computer and have also used one for extended gaming console memory and work great for both. Never needed to deal with tech support and the drive is plug and play. I'd recommend this drive for sure.

author: Mara Jo Miller
title: Works great!!
content: excellent for storage of pics from my computer

author: RJ
title: Quality product
content: I've been using this hard drive for close to a year now and it has performed flawlessly.  Transfer speeds are impressive and unlike some other brands these Toshiba's don't heat up when transferring large files.  Physically it's a very small drive and feels sturdy and well made.  One of my oldest portable hard drives is a Toshiba from 9 years ago, and it still continues to work perfectly today, so I have high hopes for this drive!

author: Deanna
title: As described
content: Item is as described. I just plugged it in and was able to backup my whole computer on it. I will try to update review at a later time once I have used it more.

author: Dennis Jerrold
title: They're great and I've had my first one now several years.
content:
I like how the little indicator light is either white or blue to let you know if you are using USB 2 or USB 3 respectively.  Very fast data transfer even on 2, but specially on 3.  When you want to get the junk off your internal hard drive, but you're not quite ready to delete it, these are the answer!

I've got 3 of these now...nuff said.

author: Devin Freese
title: Good deal .
content: Portable,  saved all my pictures,  college work from the past and present.  With lots more space.

author: Jon93
title: Struck out for me within a day
content: I put some music and videos on it just fine. The next day when I went to use it, my computer would not recognize it. Restarted my computer, tried a different port, different cord, no luck. I brought it over to a Mac I have and was able to wipe it successfully from disk utility (wouldn't read the drive either even though my mac was capable of reading NTFS). Being that I was able to wipe it, it could have been a fluke and after wiping it I suppose it could have worked fine, but I have had external hard drives of every brand searching for a reliable one. I have had too many break down on me to take and chances with my data. This was my first Toshiba. Luckily I have backups of my backups, and the data I transferred was from one of my bigger externals already backed up.

author: Suzanne Kramer
title: Crashed after 4 months. Data not recoverable
content: I have always purchased Toshiba. After only 3 months, with 2gb of info on the drive, it crashed. Data not recoverable. I am beyond upset. I cant possibly recreate all the documents that I lost. I wish I had read the reviews first. And only a 30 day return policy. Having to spend a ton to attempt to recover data. Should have had a 90 return policy considering the loss I have incurred.

author: Karen Alva López
title: AFTER 7 MONTHS IT STOPPED WORKING
content: I bought this product in December to be able to safe al my wedding pictures and videos, and after just 7 months it stopped working and I may lose all the information I saved there. I am trying to reach the producer because the deadline for amazon to intervene was 6 months, so now I depend on Toshiba's customer service team. I expect them not just to refund my money back, but also help me recovering the valuable información I had in the external memory.

author: JEDrury
title: A reliable "work horse" hard drive
content:
For three years, a Toshiba portable HD was used for my files. I pulled it "in and out" of my bag, connecting and un-connecting it six times a day. I replaced the cords after they became frazzled. It was a workhorse until recently, when I detached the cord from the base and the metal connectors slid out from the base. This was a warning even though it still worked but I needed to more gently work with it. These little hints of mechanical vulnerability need to be listened to. So, I bought the new Toshiba 1 TB; it is noticeably faster accessing my data, smaller, lighter and more compact than the original. The price was right as well.

November 2017 Update: Be careful with the cable on these HDs as they are delicate and can go bad. They are the first to go, get a back up cable which on Amazon are sturdier than the original.

author: Scott
title: WARNING-Only backs up 1 device!
content: When I saw this on Amazon, compared it to other backup/storage devices, read the reviews and for the price, I bought it. NONE of the reviews I read stated that this device will backup only ONE computer. My previous backup device, Click-Free, backed up all 3 of my computers plus two iPhones with no problems. This Toshiba backup device recognizes ONLY ONE COMPUTER! If you try to backup a second, it will overwrite the backup of the first computer! Ridiculous for a backup device to recognize only one computer to back up. It's going back!

author: Chevymom53
title: not worth it
content: I started with back up, two days and then you cant access the files, then I had to erase it took 5 min to delete two days. Now I am adding a folder one by one. My hard drive is only 500 gig. Now I get errors saying Window no space, this has nothing to do and says out of space. I am sending this back. Called tech support, stupid.  I also formatted the whole drive just a copy and paste, same error message, Now My computer had 500 gig and I am only copying photos and doc maybe 30 gig and it wont even take this amount. Something wrong.

author: Mike
title: Cheap, but at what cost?
content:
It'll get the job done, but it makes a racket. I'm always afraid that it's going to crash because it'll whir and click even after I safely eject it.
I saved a couple dollars on my gas bill because it doubles as a heater! If you're looking for a drive that'll last more than two years, look for another brand.

author: Ray Carney
title: A disaster
content: Used lightly only for weekly backups. Started giving read-write errors after about six months. I kept reformatting and trying again. Died completely as of the date of this posting, at around the 18 month period. Probably less than 100 hours of use total and it's gone, and so are my backups. NOT RECOMMENDED unless you want to spend more time trying to recapture your data than creating it.

author: Antonio
title: Toshiba Canvio me encata el producto
content:
Tiene una composición plástica de excelente calidad, me agrado mucho su tamaño y diseño, y funciona muy bien al momento de almacenar información.

Estoy feliz con mi compra.

author: Berto
title: A must have for any computer owner for the purposes of backup. Just be aware of the mentioned caveat if using included software
content:
I purchased this portable hard drive to replace an old desktop external hard drive which used an external power supply which I wanted to get rid of. This hard drive is way smaller than the other external hard drive that I was using before this one which is what I wanted. It came with an extremely short USB 3.0 cable which I did not like because it is too short for my needs as I am using this external hard drive to backup my desktop computer. Since the length of the USB cable did not suit my needs, I just use my USB cable from my Samsung Galaxy S6 phone and it works just as well.

This hard drive comes with NTI Backup Now EZ 4 which allows you to create a complete system backup as well as a file and folders backup jobs. The included backup software works well but there is one caveat which I have come across. When making a files and folder backup which include files with a file extension that the software does not have listed in its list of file extensions for different file types, the backup will not include the files that have an extension that is not listed in the list of file extensions for the different file types. I had 22 pictures of which 10 have an extension of .jpg and the other 12 had the extension of .jpeg. Since the extension .jpeg was not in the list of file extensions for picture files, my pictures which had have the extension of .jpeg did not get backed up. Fortunately, I was able to discover this and the solution is simple. The solution is to add the extensions to the list of file extensions that are not in the list. Doing so will get the files backed up. You can also use any other backup software you chose as you are not limited to using the backup software it comes with.

author: D. McLean
title: Atrocious performance with small files; failed after 11 months
content:
(The 2 TB model)

Update 17-November-2019

This drive began to fail a two months ago. The symptoms are a drastic read/write slowdown of 50% on partitions near the end of the drive and intermittent I/O errors. It appears that the designers have made error-correcting firmware that silently conceals hardware failures.

Outside Amazon's and Toshiba's warranty periods, so I'm SOL.

The drive is garbage and the corporate philosophy behind aims to deceive. Please do not buy.
-----------------------------------------------
Original review...

For reading and writing small files, transfer rates measure about .5 MB/s and .3 MB/s. It seems to have an onboard buffer that makes the transfer rate appear much higher until the buffer fills. Once the buffer fills, the rate slows down drastically. It continues to write for a minute or so even after any write operations complete on the computer side. Transfer rates for large, sequential files are typical for a 5400 rpm 2.5" drive.

I contacted Toshiba support in an attempt to find out the drive's normal operation. Their non-response: "We do not have the read write speed information for external hard drives." How about that? The manufacturer will not disclose to customers the actual specs of their own product! The specs sheet states "Up to 5 Gb/s", which is simply the maximum speed of USB 3. Marketing mis-direction at its very finest.

On the plus side, the drive is small, convenient, and elegant in appearance. And it has not failed after several months of use. Just don't expect its performance to match its presentation and marketing.

The drive can be connected to either USB 2 or USB 3.  The case light turns blue for USB 3 vs. white for USB 2. Connected via USB 3, initial transfer speed are much higher, again only until its internal buffer fills. After that, the USB type does not matter because the sustained transfer rate is far below USB 2 speeds.

author: Adrenaline
title: Runs cool and transfers data quickly.
content:
I have owned this drive for 1 week.  I am impressed with how cool it runs; it does not get hot like my older 2010 model external hdds.  I am also impressed with how lightweight it is, and I also like the shape of it and that it is pretty small.  It's also nice that it is plug and play and does not require a separate power source.  I glanced at the NTI backup software and the PogoPlay cloud data access software but did not use it yet since Windows backup handles my backup needs and plugging the drive into the usb port on my router handles my cloud data access needs.  To note, the user interface of the NTI backup software is nice looking and easy to use.  When I used the drive to take a system image of my mom's new laptop, the data transfer rate was averaging ~110MBps since her laptop has usb 3.0 capability.  At home I only have usb 2.0 so my speeds are just ~10MBps which is to be expected.  The light on it is white and blinks during data transfer, but it is not intrusive or anoying at all in my opinion.  I like this drive a lot and am probably going to buy 1 or 2 more.  The Amazon Basics external hard drive case I got with it as a free gift is also awesome.  Here is the link for that: http://www.amazon.com/AmazonBasics-External-Hard-Drive-Case/dp/B00F5CKWBA

I will update this review in the future if any cons arise.

author: Christine C.
title: A few annoyances
content:
I recently needed another external hard drive, and after price shopping, I got this Toshiba model for what seemed like a good price. The installation was quick and easy, it comes with a USB 3.0 compatability, and I get about 1.86 Tb of space.

However, after using it for a few weeks, I have noticed a few awfully annoying things that I have never noticed with my Seagate or WD models. First, whenever I go back on a video file and come to the point I was when I went back, the video ALWAYS pauses. It seems to be quite a common problem because my mother's Toshiba hard drive does the same thing, and I have never had any issues in the past decade with Seagate or WD models.

Also, at least in the case of my specific unit, I was moving some files to my mother's desktop and decided to rearrange my files while I was there. When I brought it back to my laptop, it detected a problem with the device and requested to fix it. The fix was annoying, but thankfully, nothing was deleted. However, it happened a few more times whenever I went between different computers. Both my mother's desktop and my laptop are Windows-based systems. The only difference is I'm running Windows 8 and she is running Windows 7.

With just these two annoyances, I'm a bit reluctant to repurchase another external hard drive from Toshiba any time soon. I'll hold onto the one I purchased for now, because I need it and the problems have just been annoyances thus far, but I don't quite recommend this unit if you can find one from Seagate or WD for around the same price point.

author: 1DoctorGenius
title: What?? It is not capable of flying!! Yup because Its a Reliable External Hard Drive :)
content:
One word that describes it - "Reliable". This is my preferred brand of external hard drive. It comes well packed and is easy to setup...just plug and play. I also like the fact that it does not heat up when you are transferring data between the Hard Drive and your laptop or computer. Having USB 3.0 helps as data transfer is faster.

It also comes with a backup software (NTI) which is simply crappy :), especially the scheduler. Sorry Toshiba..hey but that's a free Software and I didn't buy your hard drive knowing that you have this free Software included. Even if you don't provide the software, your hard drive is still the best.
Don't get me wrong people, if you are not very organized (don't file your documents, pictures systematically), this Software will be helpful. On the other hand if you are very organized, you know exactly what to backup and it will be quick without the software.

Another thing is the life of the drive. It should last for many years but you need to make sure you don't abuse it and keep it in a reliable case.
Also, make sure that it is not the only source of your backup. I keep two back-ups of my critical data.

I have posted the unboxing video for this harddrive and case for this harddrive.
You can look for the following on youtube: "Unboxing & Usage of Toshiba Canvio Connect II & Amazonbasics external hard drive case".

author: LawyerMom
title: It's small, quiet, reliable, easy to format, and comes with Paragon NTFS for Mac if you want to share the drive between OSs
content: I still can't believe how inexpensive 2 terabyte drives are nowadays. And this one is good - easy to set up, reliable, and whisper-quiet. Two added benefits for MacOS users like myself. 1) it comes preformatted for Windows machines, but formatting it for Mac is very easy if that's what you want; I did that because I've set it up as my new Time Machine backup drive. 2) if you want to keep the drive set for NTFS formatting so you can bring it to a Windows machine as needed, Toshiba includes a free license for Paragon's NTFS driver for Mac so your Mac can read and write to the drive in its original formatting. Granted, that license is limited to Toshiba drives, but Paragon's NTFS for Mac is a fabulously effective and reliable driver that normally sells for $20, so getting it for free is wonderful even if just for this drive.

author: Mark (.
title: Unbelievable, 1 TB for under $50.  Worth upgrading those older USB drives.
content: I am using these drives to backup my Windows 2008 R2 server, only USB 2.0 ports.  They work perfectly in the USB 2.0 ports, yes I know they would be faster in the 3.0 ports, but I really don't want to tear apart my server and install a new board.  The 2.0 is great for the backups I do, 300 GB in a 2 hour time frame at night when the server is not being used.  I initially tested on a system with USB 3.0 ports and they worked there as well, speed was noticeably better.  I will have to wait to see if the constant removal every week causes and issues.  I have a set of Seagate USB drives that are not recognized half of the time after connecting because of repeated connection/disconnection.  They will be replaced with these soon.

Companies need to remember that many people use Linux now and many defecting from Windows and it's intrusive interruptions and pestering.

author: gMaC
title: Make sure of the Compatiblity with your OS.
content:
I bought this Canvio Advance Hard Drive mainly for the Toshiba name, but also I wanted the 'back-up' capabilities the 'Advanced' one has over the Basic Model. However, it is not compatible with my Vista OS. Unfortunately, this important info is only stated on the side of the box so I did not know until I received the order. It shows, "compatible with Win 10, Win 8.1, and Win 7, and also MAC.  I checked out the Canvio BASIC Hard Drive compatibility from another retailers website, and it shows to be compatible with Win 8, Win 7, Win Vista, and Win XP. Also with MAC.

author: JhonSnow777
title: The Best solution for XBOX ONE External Storage
content: I bought this External HDD instead the Seagate advertised as "Xbox One Compatible" it cost like $30 more than the Toshiba one and has the same capacity 2TB, same specs, so the Toshiba is the smartest option to me. Just turn on your Xbox and plug in the HDD after, always insert the HDD with the system on, format and will be ready to install games, the system recognize the new device automaticly and prompt you the option to format it. I had bad experiences with Seagate HDD's in the past, so i promise to myself dont buy any other again, since then i switched to Toshiba, i have several HDD from them now, mostly external and none ever fail. In my opinion Toshiba is the greatest solution when is about mechanical HDD's. 2TB for just $60 will let you storage an average of 50 to 70 games, more than enough to me. Totally recomend it.

author: Oz
title: I would purchase this hard drive again.
content:
I bought the 3 TB unit (for under $100) and I am very happy with my purchase.  I have been using it for photos, including RAW files (which are much larger than JPG's), and I've had no issues with file storage, fidelity, or retrieval speeds.
  The hard drive itself is slightly larger than a deck of cards, and comes with one cord which connects to a USB port on your computer or device.  This size and simplicity make it very portable, and unobtrusive even on a small desk.  It has a small light that comes on when it is running a task, which I liked, because physical cues are nice when you first get an item and wanting to know if it is working properly. The drive does make a whisper of a noise, but it is still very quiet (the fans on many computers are noisier than this drive), and it is only intermittent, not a constant noise.
  Overall, I am very pleased with this purchase, and based on my experience, have already recommended this product to friends.

The speed tapers off as more data is written onto the disk, apparently because the outer tracks are used at first, the inner tracks with lower surface speed later. Slow down is significant. I did not yet measure slow down  but could be a factor of 2. Overall - roughly comparable to a medium quality USB stick. Still rate the convenience high - I back up over night.

Due to the large size, this takes about two and a half days. Following that, I did a few Time Machine backups. That's a lot of constant activity. The drive got warm, but not hot.

The cable connector is solid. With any compact drive, it pays to be gentle with this socket. No problem with this one.

The drive ships with some backup software but I did not use it.

The shiny plastic case looks pretty good.

content:

They remain powered on 24/7 but are only written to once a day, where I have a robocopy script mirror my main (Seagate) drives over to them.

To anyone saying "don't put any data on here you don't want to lose," that goes for literally every hard drive. They all can and WILL fail. Use external drives for backup purposes, not for the sole copy of anything.

author: Dano
title: XBOX ONE COMPATIBLE!
content:
I bought this device specifically for the Xbox one.

Two things to know about this device when using it with the Xbox one.  When using the hard drive for the first time, make sure you have your Xbox one turned on first and that you are logged on to your account.  If you have the hard drive plugged in when turning on the Xbox one (for the first time), it will not recognize the drive.  It didn't work for me.  After 10 minutes of useless research and cursing, I was about to pack it up and send it back to Amazon.  So I decided one last try..... I unplugged it, turned on my Xbox one, logged into my account and then I plugged the hard drive in and VICTORY!  The XB1 recognized the drive and two quick clicks later, it was ready to go.

Second, after moving 12 games over to the hard drive, I turned off the XB1.  Next day when I turned on my XB1 with the hard drive still plugged in, there was nothing on my hard drive (external).  It showed that I had items saved onto the drive but, I could not see any games.  First thought, another worthless hard drive!  But, before I threw it against the wall (not really) I unplugged hard drive and plugged it back into the XB1 and everything was there.  So, ever since this issue, I have unplugged the hard drive and plugged it back in after turning on the XB1.  Maybe I had a glitch but, up to you.

Moving along now....

I bought mine for $81 (brand new) from Amazon. I was lucky.  Right now, it is going for $119.  It says 2GB but, after I formatted it for the XB1 and ran it for the first time, it has 1.8TB for actual use.  Its power source is the device it is plugged in too.  It appears to be sturdy and well made.  I like the tiny little cushions on the bottom of the hard drive that prevents it from sliding around.  It comes with a 3.0 usb type-A/micro type-b cable.  This cable is SHORT and very thin.  The end that goes into the hard drive, in my opinion, is a little unstable for me (it felt like it would come out it you it around).  There is a solution for this issue but, you will have to pay extra cash.  After doing much research on portable hard drives, a lot of folks have had this issue (not only on Amazon but, elsewhere).  So, I bought a two-pack, from Cable Matters, of 3.0 usb type-A/micro-b cables.  They are 3 feet long, THICKER and they fit into the hard drive and XB1 like they SHOULD be, SNUG.  This will save you time.  Why?  Because you will end up talking to the Toshiba and requesting for another cable.  In my opinion.

Games being moved from the internal hard drive to the external hard drive will vary in the time it takes to move it.  The largest game moved was 48.8 GB and it took just under 14 minutes.  Moving games back is slightly faster.  As for playing games from the external hard drive, there might be a quicker load time as compared to the internal drive but, as far as I am concerned, it works.  The only thing I have not done is to download a game from Microsoft directly onto my external drive.  I haven't set up that option yet.  Last thing when it comes to downloads, transfers, etc. I downloaded Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag (free) and it took 3 hours.  Transfer to the external from the internal took 7 minutes plus.

My rating it 4 may or may not change over the course of this device.  No electronic device gets a 5-star or a 1-star rating.  5-star, to me, means that it is perfect, no such thing.  1-star means it dies tomorrow or within a year.

Overall, great, for now as it pertains to the XB1.  The company says it is compatible with Windows 7, 8, 8.1.  Well, Windows 10 is about to be released and I will wait before I buy an external hard drive as a back-up.  This is a very, very quite external hard drive, simple as that.  You want noise?  The power source for XB1 is louder, HOURS after it has not been in use.  Go figure.  As of now, it is a great external hard drive for the XB1 (minus the cable.  Trust me, buy the cable I mentioned earlier or something similar.  A great or good sturdy cable makes all the difference in the world).

Last words, my review will change if the drive has issues.  I don't plan on moving mine around unless it is to be cleaned.  I also, DO NOT, work for Toshiba, Amazon, Microsoft, Cable Matters, any blog site, etc.  I am just a consumer who was looking for an external hard drive for my XB1.  I DO NOT KNOW how this device will work on a laptop, computer, PS4 or mobile phone.  That will be up to you.

PS - I have owned this item for less then a week and it was bought through Amazon.

PSS - Just because a device says 1TB, 2TB, 3TB, etc. IT DOES NOT MEAN IT HAS THAT AMOUNT OF SPACE AVAILABLE!  Why?  Software that comes with the device.  This is for the folks who always have this complaint..... Avoid this issue and RESEARCH BEFORE BUYING!
