title: Mixed emotions
content: This thing is a bit clunkier and noisier and vibrates more than I would like.  I now have three such drives...  a WD USB 2.0 320GB from 11 years ago...  a Toshiba USB 3.0 1TB from 7 years ago...  and this new Toshiba USB 3.0 4TB.  The old ones are quieter..  vibrate less when spinning...  they have rubber feet... this new new does not which enhances its noise when sitting on the desktop.  I put it on a cork drink coaster to quiet it.  The case is a little thick and has square edges compared to most others including my old drives... just not as sleek.  I hope the extra vibration doesn't mean an early failure.  Time will tell.

author: Skyhawk
title: Comes Formatted with Old Fashion Format. Included Backup Software is Unnecessary. 3TB
content:
Comes Formatted with Old Fashion Format (NTFS). Included Backup Software is Unnecessary. 3TB size.

Upon plugging in the Drive, Mac OS recognizes it as non-standard.  Reformatting was virtually automatic and took 30 seconds.  I simply had to click on the Time Machine an answer yes regarding using the drive for backups.

I purchased the 3 TB unit.  Working well so far.

Only criticism is blue LED access indicator.  (Blue lights should be avoided.)

author: michael mascara jr.
title: Upgrade Xbox storage
content: Using this to give my Xbox One more storage. Games load significantly faster having them installed on the external as opposed to the internal. My Xbox seemed really sluggish before I purchased this. Also make sure you turn on your Xbox before plugging this in or it won't register. After that you won't ever need to unplug it.

author: nh
title: slow but reliable
content: years ago i bought 4 external hard drives--2 were toshibas and the other two a different brand. the toshibas were annoyingly slow; the other two fast. fast forward to now and the toshibas are still going strong, slow but reliable. the other two died, which is why i went for a toshiba this time. to me reliability is more important than speed.

author: Keisha
title: Doesnt work after 3 months!
content: I have only had the device since May 28, 2019 and didn't actually use it until a couple weeks later. Point is I have had a couple hard drives before for years and they still work. This one stopped working in mid August 2019. I thought it was my computer but I can still connect other external hard drives. I can use all of my USB ports and I have updated everything. The light comes on, you can feel it and sometimes hear it but nothing on the PC. I hate I saved some important pictures, music and videos on here because now their just gone :-( and theres no Amazon tech support, poor customer service agents are trying to help me.

author: Jeff Andreson
title: Drive works great but, setup instructions no help in my application
content: I bought this drive to attach to the USB 3.0 port on my router to act as a video and music server for my home. I finally got it working and all is well with the drive. It's working great as a resource that is always on even if none of our PC's is. Additionally, we have brought it with us on ski trips so we have our tunes and videos with us. The only disappointment I have with the product is the instructions and accompanying software were written with direct pc attachment only in mind. Thankfully, others on the net have shared their experience with tutorials showing how to attach directly to a LAN.

author: AJAY
title: A lot of space for the price }:o)
content: So far so good. I ordered this for my daughter in college. So that she would have a separate device to back up her laptop. We have one at home and it works fine so I thought she would fair better with one as well. Blue it the UK color so I was really happy about that. She had already backed up her data and the device is working great. Space is very limited in college land for parking to shopping to the tiny refrigerators shared by two, everything is quite confined. It feels great to be able to spread out wherever one can. I like the Toshiba brand I had purchased two laptops by them but her charge port broke. So when I saw this was made by Toshiba I knew it was good quality. That laptop lasted from middle school through the first year of college...

author: MARK DAVID MINK
title: Warning - Toshiba Discontined Software and Support
content: Important Notice – CANVIO® Series (Products DTW1xx, DTC8xx, v73600-x, DTD2xx that contained Pogoplug® PC)  As Cloud Engines, Inc. already announced, Pogoplug® PC for Toshiba Users permanently ceased operation and support on September 30th, 2017 at 11PM (Pacific Daylight Time). Toshiba permanently ceased support at the same time. This change applies to all Pogoplug® products including but not limited to the free cloud storage services, the Pogoplug® Backup Software, Pogoplug® Remote Access, the Pogoplug® web application, and Pogoplug®’s mobile apps. After September 30th, 2017 at 11PM (Pacific Daylight Time) any data still remaining on Pogoplug®’s servers was permanently destroyed.

author: Sunflower Musical
title: Toshiba Canvio Advance 2TB Portable External Hard Drive USB 3.0
content: External hard drive used as a data back up to several laptops and desktop computers. 2 TB storage is plenty of space.  Drive was found by devices right away and copy times for large amounts of data was short.  Stored in a waterproof safe for security.

author: Cass Alexander
title: Easy & lots of space!!
content: This was very easy to use I simply plugged it in to my computer and was able to transfer documents and pictures right away it works on Mac & Windows. There's so much space with 1 TB it's awesome. I am so glad that I bought this one instead of other brands. I have tried pretty much them all and this one has been the simplest to use.

author: Michael Weldert
title: Don't buy this
content: Got this on August 21, but was on vacay so didn't plug it in for a few days.  Have only used it for about 30 days and it is corrupted, says to reformt drive, which I've done over and over but it doesn't fix the problem.  So drive is unusable and amazon says it is past the 30 day return period.  Buyer beware!!!!!

author: Mr. Man
title: Software is terrible.
content: The drive itself is nice. A good price for a lot of storage capacity. The storage backup software that comes with the drive is  unusable.

author: Kevin
title: Great for movies and data
content: very satisfied with this Toshiba portable hard drive. Bought it for the sole purpose of backing up my Samsung 1TB computer. Plugged it in via USB and all the installation instructions were easy to followed on my computer. I bought the 3 TB at a nice price, with no hitches with the backup process and now feel a bit of comfort knowing that my files are safer. This drive works with both 2.0 and 3.0 USB ports, obviously will download faster if you use a 3.0 hub. My computer is 5 years old and I thought my USB ports were probably all 2.0 but turns out, I had one 3.0 USB so always good to check. One tip is that 3.0 USB ports are blue in the female inside part of your computer. So if you are not sure, check it out. It does come with the necessary USB cable, 21 inches in length and a very limited instruction pamphlet. The unit itself is very sleek looking, polished black that will show fingerprint smudges but small enough to wipe clean fairly easily. Dimensions of the drive are 3" x 4" length and width and the thickness of the unit is 3/4 inches in depth, so a bit larger that a deck of paying cards.

author: ee
title: works seemlessly with my linux system
content: my plan is to use this HD as an external backup of my computer.  using only linux as my sole OS, this HD did a true plug-n-play set-up.  it appears to have energy saving features which means that when 1st accessing the drive, it takes a few seconds to activate, but once running, navigation is very responsive.  this is my 2nd Toshiba HD.  the 1st one (which i am still using) is a 500Gb external.  i've had absolutely no problems with the 500Gb drive which is why i opted for this unit.

author: Kevin
title: Initial Impressions Are Excellent
content: I have not had this long, nor have I had to use it for the reason I bought it - to back up my hard drive in case of crash/ransomware/virus attack. I have cloned my system hard drive, and actually used this drive to run Windows 10 on an old Vista machine, so it does work. It is small, compact and easy to use. Since my machine is a tad out of date, it took a very long time to format (I don't like the "quick format" option} and over 12 hours to clone my 1 TB drive. But first impressions of this drive are good. I have no idea the reliability of it long term, however.

author: Brett
title: Works perfect for video editing on a Macbook Pro!
content: I have used hard drive to produce 2 full length movies (as seen on Amazon)-and I must say it works as well as my MacBooks internal drive. It's a quick drive and very light. Not 1 problem with this drive. I have used other drives from other manufacturers and this is one of my favorites.

author: LindyLou
title: Great to backup important files and photos
content: I wanted a small portable hard drive to easily back up important files and photos and give myself one more option to ensure I would keep these files and photos safe. This hard drive is perfect for that. Easy to use and easy to back up all the electronic files I need, and enough storage space to last for a long time. So far, it's working perfectly.

author: DavidE
title: Good Hardware BUT BAD Software
content: I purchased this 2TB device (May 2019) in order to backup my 2 desktops, and 3 laptops.  For some reason, the software will only recognize ONE device and will not allow me to backup any other devices onto it.  I initially backuped a desktop, was unable to do another, so deleted that one, backuped the other laptop, changed the schedule to "daily" (thinking that was the problem), but it again would not recognize more than one device.  Toshiba tech support said I must have conflicting software that won't allow the "other" device to be recognized, but if it initially sees both devices ... ?  Will now try to see if I can use it without the Toshiba software (which I am not satisfied with).

author: Roger
title: Great Portable USB 3 External Hard Drive.
content: Great USB3 drive that works on USB1.1 and USB 2.0. Fast access and great back up drive. Have formated on Mac and PC with out problems. You will notice a transfer slowdown on USB 1.1 and 2.0 as the drive is USB 3. Great product andband size.

author: idahomoemoscow
title: Go easy
content: Good little drive. Good for minor back up but wouldn’t recommend pushing a ton of data all at once. Gets quite hot

author: Howard Reid
title: I am one very satisfied customer. I have it plugged in right now ...
content: I just recently purchased this product. I use it for my video games storage. I must say that when it comes to Toshiba, I am one very satisfied customer. I have it plugged in right now in my Xbox One. No strange sounds (you know. Like if the hard drive is failing and about to die) period! I only wish they had more available, like a 4TB and greater. 5 Stars most definitely.

author: Dhughes
title: Reformatting required on newer OS Sierra versions
content:
So although the description claims this thing is completely compatible with Mac without reformatting, I'm running OS Sierra 10.12 and Amazon customer service (which did a great job, very polite and listened well) looked on the Toshiba site which only states this drive is compatible up to like 10.11 or something, some version before what I have. He also tried to connect to Toshiba customer service, but of course they are closed on the weekends. I'm unable to run Time Machine and there seems to be no way around it so this otherwise very compact and nice-seeming drive is probably going to have to be returned. Such a waste of my time.
Update**: My rad husband was able to reformat this thing to exFAT on his Windows PC. So much for no reformatting, but the backup seems to be happening.

author: jimmy fincher
title: External Hard Drive is as good as
content:
a External Hard Drive needs to have a  folder and the another folder created to keep its' operation system safe
If you accidentally erase them you may have trouble. I don't  leave mine hooked up either

author: marquis
title: Speedy, Compact, and Portable
content: Worked fine right out of the box.  Although I don't measure actual speeds like more technology minded people, this drive seems plenty fast to me.  Also compact and very portable.

author: rtc331
title: Compact and light, easy to use
content: The superior technical aspects have already been described by many so I won't go into those details. I live in an earthquake zone and having a back-up for my computer with my grab-and-run earthquake kit is very important to me; so the fact that this portable hard drive is compact and light is a plus for this purpose.  It's also serves as my regular back-up in case anything happens to my computer. The price point is excellent for the quality.

author: Meg
title: Breaks very easily
content: I just opened this, put some files on it, put it back in the box to keep it safe until I get a case, and today it is broken. I'm not sure if I just got a dud, but it was working yesterday and today you can hear the clicking inside. It won't pull up on a computer and the light won't flash. Just make sure you try it out in time to return it. Unfortunately, I didn't open it in time to have the option of return/exchange.

author: Dana in NY
title: As advertised, convenient portable memory
content: I bought this in order to back up home computers and be able to store the backups in another location for safety.  Set up easily and recognized effortlessly by devices.  Does what it says, it's easy, portable memory, great for backups.

author: Rocky
title: Software not working
content: Software that comes with this is not working . I am still able to use so far. Good quality and reliability.

author: The Count of Monte Carlos
title: Stop working after about 1 month
content:
Not able to do anything with it after a month.
Not able to do backups at all.
Will not up on my desktop
It kept telling me that it was not mounted.
DO NOT WAIST YOUR MONEY AS I DID ON THIS PRODUCT.........

author: Michael Jay Brouillette
title: WOW!
content: Wow! I am really impressed by this little drive! The USB 3.0 connection means no 'wall-wart' power brick. One cable handles everything, power AND interface. The USB 3.0 interface also makes it fast enough to be an alternative boot disk for my MacBook Pro. I should have purchased the little case to store the case and cable.

author: Edwing Noguera
title: Perdí toda mi información
content: Lo peor que me paso respalde años de trabajo en el disco duro y una semana después de hacer el respaldo no pude acceder a mis archivos.... perdí todo mi trabajo no compren este producto servicio técnico pésimo

author: MP
title: piece of crap
content: used it for two years and completely stopped working.  super super slow. takes forever to connect to the computer, save and move files.  later on it had issues being recognized by my computer.  I fixed it a few times and it kept getting worse.  now it does not even light up anymore when connected.  just dead.

author: BLD
title: Best price around for the capacity.
content: Most affordable I have found in the .5 to 1 TB range. Plastic case feels a bit flimsy, but it's what in side that counts and these work great.  No failures.

author: spiker_man
title: So-So External Hard Drive
content: I'm only giving this three stars because I've had to replace three of them over the past year at work. We've got them attached to our server and swap them out on a weekly basis. They work fine for a while and then they just die and start giving me error messages. Thank goodness for Toshiba's warranty.

author: Patricia H.
title: Doesn’t seem as sturdy as others. Heats up too much.
content:
I got this for people to recover data off my old computer. I also figured I’d get a large one because I have a lot of data elsewhere.
I hate it. I got it from the extraction people yesterday and plugged it in.
This thing really runs warm. I’m accustomed to WD Passport external drives...they haven’t ever really heated up on me. Also, compared to my WDs, this is EXTREMELY flimsy feeling. It shakes and makes much more noise while working. It just seems all wrong and not something I’d feel comfortable carrying around.

It’s pretty?

I think i’m going to try and return it. I would never have paid this much if I knew what I was getting. Go with WD stuff.

author: Terry R Clark
title: Product Failed in Less than 2 Months
content: Not much more to say. The drive quit working properly in less than 2 months. My cpu will no longer recognize it. I wouldn't recommend this product. Pay more money to acquire an external Solid State Drive (SSD).

author: Kevin S
title: Good external drive for Xbox ONE
content: Works great on an Xbox ONE so far, I bought the 3TB model.  Plug it in while Xbox ONE was on, recognized right away and formatted it.  Files move over quick enough when  you consider you're moving 20-40 gigs of installs at a time.  Drive initializes fine on reboots so far, no having to re-plug it in because it doesn't boot up right with ONE.  Formatted capacity is 2.7TB of usable space.  It has a nice glossy black finish as well which matches ONEs finish nicely.

author: GeekAbility
title: Very Good Transfer Speeds On USB 3 Port
content: I am transferring data today to this new drive. The speed is wicked fast on a USB 3 port on an HP laptop running Win 7. The system recognized the drive right away and found the software on the drive itself with no issue. Haven't tried the other software included yet. The review I saw where a user returned the drive because of a California required notice of lead on the cable is missing something good here! Compact and looks well made. I see it is sold out right now at Amazon and third party vendors have raised their prices quite a bit to cash in. Must be a very popular drive.

author: Joe
title: A Good Hard Drive at a Good Price
content: The hard drive does what it's supposed to. However I believe that in the product description it said that right out of the box it would work back and forth between a Mac and a PC, but I ended up having to format it on the Mac in order to use it there. However, as soon as I did that (which is very easy to do) it worked between platforms with no issues and all is now well with it. When working with some files I had a few issues with the files bringing in shortcuts with them (which made a bit of a mess on the drive) but I'm not certain that it was an issue with the hard drive itself; that was more likely user error. Overall, it worked well and I would recommend it.

author: Herbert Longfellow
title: these are my fav backup disks
content: I have purchased over 20 of these (with some different variants in the line) and not one of them has failed yet. I have one that vibrates a wee bit, but still no actual problems. Really happy with these.

author: Angie
title: Crapped out on me!
content: I bought this in December of 2015.  I copied all of the files I wanted to backup onto it at that time.  Once since then, I have updated those files with the most recent copy.  I just went to update everything again, and the hard drive has crapped out already!  It has literally been sitting on my desk for these past 8 months, only moving a few feet two different times when I went to update.  It's not like it has been banged around or subjected to extreme temps.  I am very disappointed with this item.  It is just completely dead and will do nothing when I plug it in.

author: Erik  Aguirre
title: It's like have a spare computer
content: Now I don't have to worry about overflowing my laptop with so many pictures, files, Microsoft documents, presentations, and spreadsheets! It's like have a spare computer! It's also very important to save all files on your computer onto an external hard drive! You never know what might happen to your computer. Trust me, I've learned the hard way. My last laptop crashed for some reason and all of my pictures and most files were lost! Getting a reliable external hard drive like this one will save you the stress and sorrow!

author: WhiteDog
title: Speed
content:
While I'm not an expert in SSD performance, this one is plenty fast. I installed it in an external drive case and it's connected to one of my computer's USB3 port. I installed macOS 10.14.2 Mojave on it in two partitions. One contained a clone of my main Sierra system. The other is a utility disk with Mojave and various disk utilities. Though many are not yet optimized for Mojave. In any case the system runs very fast. Of course people with laptop computers may already be familiar with SSD performance, it's new to me. My main computer is a 27" iMac with a Fusion Drive.

So, my Fusion Drive is much faster than the HDDs in my old Mac Pro. And this SSD is comparatively faster still. So I'm a happy camper. Of course I can't speak to it's durability as I've only had it for a little while. As for versatility, I can pretty much use it any way I want. Buying the bare drive and an inexpensive drive case saved me at least $50 compared to an external SSD. I recommend it. Installing it in a laptop computer will probably be considerably harder to do.

author: RobinGB
title: So far so good
content: I've had this only a few weeks and normally I'd wait to write a review but to be honest I've had several Toshiba portable drives over many years and not even one of them has failed. I use them for Time Machine backups, cloned backups, and portable storage--mostly for transferring large files from one computer/drive to another and none of the drives have ever failed. I don't use them with any software provided for backups as I have my own applications but for everything I know about--5 stars.

author: Brian Epperson
title: Works like it's suppose to so far
content: don't know what to compare speed to, and it has the space it advertises.  Haven't had it long, but it works as expected.  I mean, it's a storage device, and it's storing.  My first Toshiba storage device.

author: Mpumamandy
title: It is great to be able to throw a large amount of ...
content: This is my second purchase of this item.  One I bought about 5 years ago it is still going strong.  After all this time it is nearly filled up so I got another.  It is great to be able to throw a large amount of data onto one of these and take them with me on vacation or when I travel for work.

author: Brian
title: Worked once and then never again
content:
I used this portable HDD to transfer large amount of files. Brought it home, left it on my desk for few months, entirely forgetting about it. Don't even remember if I transfered those files onto my home computer.
Now, months later, I plug it in, to see what's on it, and guess what - it does not work! It is trying to spool up, I can hear it clicking and the slight "woop" as it spins the platter inside, but then it stops and tries again, and again, and again... until it burns itself, I guess.
I chose TOSHIBA because their drives are the best, but this one is not the same quality as their internal HDDs. Terribly disappointed, because I REALLY need a portable HDD today, and I have one - but it let me down.
I hate it when simple thing that one depends on breaks at the worst possible time.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Small footprint, great drive
content: I was very pleased to see how small this 3 tb unit really was.  The 3.0 USB makes moving files from my computer quick and easy.  I'm very pleased with this purchase.  And the price was right too.  I highly recommend this drive and seller.  It arrived when it said it would.

author: SparkBz
title: works great but..
content: works great but easy to slide off hard-drive doesn't have rubber dot on the bottom so it slide off easy if you had it on the table however i wrap it with a rubber ban now doesn't slide off, easy to look for it too cause of the bright blue color outer case.

author: Louis L Crichlow
title: because it was working fine until the issue
content: I purchased this item last year and in less than a year it malfunctioned. I give it a 3 star, because it was working fine until the issue, but I wasn't happy with Toshiba's final decision. It was the final decision that swayed me to even write this review. I called customer service once and went thru the issue, but then when I thought it was resolved, heard or saw nothing come in the mail. I had to call customer service at Toshiba a second time and they tried to assist me again. Unfortunately the final result was I couldn't get my personal information off of the device and the only way to get a gift card at the value of the hard drive, was to return it. I didn't feel comfortable sending back a hard drive that had all my information on it to some random company even if they stated they would destroy the device. So after all the work trying to figure out what to do, I decided to drop the warranty of getting another device. If they know the product is malfunctioning, the company should allow me to drill the hole in the device send it to them and get the gift card. That too was a surprise that I get a gift card instead of another device, but that was a small issue compared to the fact that I lost my information and the final result was I had to decide not to bother with the warranty after several phone conversations and emails.  Needless to say, I will not get another Toshiba device.

author: Douglas
title: Not fast, but it works sometimes.
content: The other reviews were right about the speed, it ain't great. On top of that it has a hard time connecting to some computers. But, at the end of the day it can store stuff I guess.

author: Matt253545
title: Good Product
content: This is my sixth purchase of this hard drive. I am a photographer and writer. I've never had a problem with any of these drives. And, they have been dropped about six inches while running without incident. The only flaw I find is the unnecessary software included.

author: buyer-wxy
title: nice hard drive
content: I use it to backup my MacBook Pro. Gets the job done (and looks nice, too!).

author: Rik
title: I love Toshiba quality! It is very stable across many different computers with USB2, USB3 and USB3 Superspeed.
content: I love Toshiba quality! This is a great drive and I have been working with computers and hard drives for 35 years. However, USB3 technology is not as stable as it should be since they keep reducing the power to the ports. I purchased a second cable that has 2 USB cables in one (the data and a power USB connector) It is very stable across many different computers with USB2, USB3 and USB3 Superspeed. It does not shut off and reconnect like other USB3 external hard drives often do (both 2.5 and 3.5). In my experience with all brands, Toshiba and Fujitsu (now owned by Toshiba) have the lowest failure rate.

author: Roberta G.
title: I am disappointed that I cannot use it via USB connection with my NetGear R7000 Router.
content: This was easy to set up, however, I wanted to use it to backup two separate laptops by using the USB connection in my R700 router.  The 1 TB model was listed on the NetGear site as being compatible so I assumed that the 3 TB would also work.  It doesn't.  I have to disconnect/reconnect it when I want to backup my two different laptops. I don't have them networked and probably won't. I used it to backup my HP laptop running Win 7 Home Premium.  I am not using the included backup software. I used Norton 360 to do a complete file backup but discovered that it doesn't include a system image, so I ran WindowsImageBackup. I also have a Toshiba Satellite laptop running Win 8.1. I'm still looking for  better comprehensive backup software that includes a system image and incremental backups that has a user friendly format. With Norton and Windows I can't see individual files.

author: oracle guardian
title: I also love how it has a light and the fact that ...
content: Very simple to use and to format to my HP Pavilion that I got.  I also love how it has a light and the fact that it is very small and light, which means less weight in my bag(s) for me.  I haven't used it often, but I think it is worth the money even though I have a 1TB hhd on my laptop, but I have a lot of music compositions I need to turn into pdf's and such for assignments or side projects and I don't have to worry about them being wiped out.  A definite investment.

author: Oscar V.
title: Functional and efficient
content: It is extremely well built and does everfything it says it can do. I'm using it as an external hard drive for my Blue Ray Films (70 Films actually) and Computer BackUp. It Works fine with USB 2.0 and 3.0 If you add a password with bitlocker, have a lot of patience, it will take almost a day encrypting. This on my second external Hard Drive Toshiba, the previous 1TB 4 years ago and I have not had any inconvenience or loss of data, so I recommend the toshiba brand

author: Eriberto Galvez
title: Value
content: Perfect for my Xbox.

author: Ssl
title: So far so good
content: I've been buying Canvio drives for myself and clients for many years and have never been disappointed.  Hopefully this new purchase continues my previous experience for reliability.

author: D. Bailey
title: Wow
content: I don't know why they call these hard drives, when you can easily bend them. Thank goodness they still worked after bending.

author: Michael A. Floyd
title: Time will Tell
content: Only had this for a short time, after reformatting for my Mac it was up and running. If it turns out to be as durable as they say it is. Then I’m even more excited about using this smaller more compact storage.

author: Private
title: ZERO STARS - DO NOT BUY!!!! One drive lasted six months and the other one lasted no more than 4 months.
content:
Trash, yes Trash. This unit died after about five months. I am not buying Toshiba products anymore.

Update: I bought two of these in March and BOTH have now failed! That is a 100% failure rate times two. I do not recommend that you buy these. Luckily, I have everything backed up to the cloud and did not lose anything. But, if I had fully relied on these drives, I would be out of luck and I would have lost clients. Now, I have to download 1.3 TB of data from the cloud which will take forever NO THANKS TO TOSHIBA.

author: Allison S.
title: 3x My old Memory Card!
content: My gf got me the 1TB, and believe it or not, memory space is almost gone! She got me this 3TB, and yes, 3TB is much needed, in life!

author: California Dream
title: love It
content: Its an extremely well designed piece.  It interfaced without a hitch on all my computers from windows 8 and 7 to my older desk top that I was about to recycle.  I primarily bought it to back-up my photos and videos, there is more than enough memory.  It is really small and has a whole bunch of rubber feet to place in either upright or flat.

author: Richard Levine
title: Easy & A MUST FOR PS4
content: Bought this cause my kid filled up his 500 gig memory on his ps4. I was skeptical at first but this worked like a charm. It was so easy that my 11 year old set it up himself while I was at work. Works like a charm. The games save right to this hard drive. One note.... Saved game data automatically saves to the ps4 internal drive. Not a biggie. Its great!! Large file of game saves to external and the save data is generally not a lot..

author: Amazon Customer
title: Defective!
content: I ordered this yesterday and it arrived today. I was really excited to use it for my PS4. I plugged it in.....and nothing. I tried plugging it on a Mac & Windows laptop just to see if the external hard drive will be detected.....and nothing. I’m not sure if the little circular LED looking thing at the corner is supposed to light up once it’s plugged but mine did not. I am returning this and will not order another one. I’m probably going to order another brand. Such a waste of time.

author: Bill Nevel
title: Simplicity at it's finest.
content: This was a replacement for another 3T byte external drive that got destroyed by my cat! Best thing: no external power supply. All power supplied by USB port.

author: Samantha Tapia
title: Love The Amount of Storage & The Compact Size
content: I love this External HD. It's small enough in physical size to carry in a small bag with my tablet, and could even fit in my pocket, but it has so much memory. I love that I don't have to use a power cord to the wall which makes it so convenient to use anywhere because it is powered by the device it's plugged into via usb. You plug it in and it's found, no software needed and it doesn't get hot at all. I bought this in late November 2015 but waited to review it to see if it had any issues and I'm very happy to report that I have had ZERO issues with it since I received it and it works just as it should.

author: dhbailey
title: Great portable hard drive for carrying around loads of data and media files!
content: This is a fantastic external hard drive.  I own an HP Envy x360-13 which has a fairly small internal SSD drive.  It's big enough to hold all the applications I want to have installed, and the computer is fantastic, but I needed a way to carry a huge amount of data plus some other programs which are more for entertainment and wouldn't fit on the internal drive.  This Canvio Connect 3TB Portable Hard Drive serves that purpose marvelously, with loads of additional space on it far beyond my current needs so it should serve me for many years to come.  The spinning speed I believe is 5400rpm so it's not the fastest drive on the market but the USB3 interface makes for fast data transfer.  It's compact and fits easily into the carrying bag I have to carry my computer in.  It does have a special cord that comes with it, the sort I've got on some other hard drives, but not the ubiquitous mini-USB or micro-USB that is far more prevalent in today's computer world so be careful not to lose the cable that comes with this drive.

author: T. Frink
title: Reliable Drive, Data Cable? Not so much
content:
I've been using this drive to house image backups from my laptop for a year. Only had one issue with it that started about 2 months ago. At times the drive would only connect at USB 2 instead of the much faster USB 3 connection. Then last week, the drive refused to connect at all. Thinking it might be a loose connection, I wiggled the cable. No avail. Then I re-coiled the cable into the 4 inch diameter coil I would store it in with the drive (in an Amazon drive protective case. Then it worked!

CONCLUSION: The Gigaware data cable that came with the drive while it appears thick is not, in fact durable. So I ordered a replacement cable (one that includes both a 1 foot and 3 foot cable that is warrantied for a number of years and now I no longer have an issue. It's sad that Toshiba would include a third-rate cable on a drive that has a 3-year warranty. At least I now have a cable I can rely on.

author: Gecko T
title: Disconnects Often
content: This hard drive will disconnect occasionally and then reconnect. I bought a new cable, and that did not help. I have tried various USB ports, and that hasn't helped. I'm afraid it will die on me, so I keep it backed up, but that is a risk too because when it disconnects it messes with the online back up.

author: Amazon Customer
title: small, portable, light, lots of room for files at a decent price
content: Smaller then i had imagined.  There are 2 softwares to download for it depending on what you want to use the device for.  One is regular and the other is secured/encrypted.  Those get a bit confusing if you're not too tech savvy and that would be the only thing where it would lose points in my book.  Or you can just use the old copy/paste or drag & drop method to put your files on the  drive to keep them from accidental deletion for which you don't need the software because it's ready-to-use for this method.  Small portable drive, 2 TB space.  very nice and very portable.

author: R. Startzman

author: Shalena
title: Easy to use product
content: This is exactly what I needed and for the size and price its perfect. Bought a small case to go with it - highly recommend if you are going to purchase this. I haven't had any glitches, product has been compatible with everything I've used it for. Very satisfied!

author: Roxy A
title: Easy for PS4
content: Hooked it up to my PS4. It has worked smoothly over the past couple of months. Plug and play.

author: Chuck

It works. I plugged it into my Xbox to use as the main hard drive and it’s worked fine.

Sometimes the hard drive doesn't recognize when the Xbox turns on and then I have to do a hard restart on the xbox, but that only takes 30 seconds.

author: saralorine
title: Crashed after less than 2 years

author: Israel Villatoro
title: Great Xbox One S external hardrive.
content: Love this external hard drive, hook it up to my Xbox one s to extend my hard drive space, moved all my games to it and this thing is really fast, no lag or slow down when i play my games, I highly recommend this, very happy with my purchase.

author: Mike Hunt
title: Can't go wrong with Toshiba hard drives
content: For just a little more dough I upgraded from 1 TB to 2 TB drives. I love these pocket-sized Toshiba drives. I have been using them for years. Very durable & honorable warranty

content: I purchased this external hard drive in mid December.  Used it once to store my personal files.  This evening (mid January) I wanted to check again as to how much free space I have as I am planning on upgrading my computer to a SSD along side of the HDD installed, using the external HD for back up when I do a clean install. Very simple to use, no set up and loads up fast. I have a older model also by another company that has to install before use and seems to take for ever before you can open files. author: Amazon Customer
title: Perfecto

author: DrumBum
title: I've had good luck with Toshiba external hard drives.

I only bought this one, because my last Toshiba external hard drive is about 7 years old and would hate for it to kick the bucket (after my laptop did). If anything crazy happens, I'll update this review.

author: HolaGatitos
title: Lasted 68 days
content: SERIOUS QUALITY ISSUES--Beware. This drive died 68 days after delivery. Too late for a return, too late for product support from the manufacturer, too late to recover my lost files. I went through three recovery programs to find that it is not a file issue rather the drive itself has stopped working. Sometimes it spins, other times it makes a loud noise. It never hit the ground, it was never physically damaged it is just poorly made and the lack of support is really disappointing. author: M. Everton
title: Great external hard drive for the money.
content: This is a great USB 3.0 external hard drive.  It is tiny and I love that it gets power off the USB outlet.  As with most hard drives, the usable space is a good bit less than the advertised size, but 1TB was way more than I needed anyway.  We were attracted by the price, but I have to think we would not have gotten anything better at a higher price point.

author: The Novak Family
title: Nice, small device!
content: I like this device!  It is small, requires so little desk space!  I didn't buy it for its "portability", but for its storage capacity, but it certainly IS portable.

author: Ashley Clark
title: Perfect
content: Works great, this my second purchase- decided to have his and hers rather than sharing- and I've never had an issue with either. The husband likes to drop it into a large bag with no case or anything and there's never been any issue- it's very durable. It's small, lightweight, easy to use, and I love the blue color on this one.

author: ION SALIU
title: Toshiba Canvio Connect II 1TB: Good Device
content:
I bought this useful device on October 16, 2015. It arrived according to Amazon specifications. Toshiba Canvio Connect II 1TB Portable Hard Drive started working as promised. The installation and setup is pretty simple.

I did a quick backup just to test. I always use my own creation: The best, easiest, fastest backup based on a simple batch file (totally free). Read this page on how you too can create the best backup software: http://saliu.com/best-backup.html

Next step was an important step: Full backup, the counterpart of ‘Create system image’ in Windows. The NTI software that came with my Toshiba Canvio did the system image backup twice as fast as the Windows function.

Now, I had expected the Canvio with the system image to be a BOOTABLE CLONE. That’s what I read in customer reviews before I bought the Toshiba Canvio. It is NOT the case. The system image is only bootable, but not a clone. Was I wrong, or some customer reviews were misleading?

I have no complaints about Toshiba Canvio, only about the NTI software that was bundled with the device. It has two annoying fixtures:

1) It says to ‘Activate software’. When I click, the program turns to a black screen and several Windows error messages.

2) It says ‘Create bootable USB drive’ but it does NOT work. After the progress bar reaches 100%, the final message reads ‘Failed to create bootable device’. Even worse, the drive disappears from the list of drives for my PC. I have to reformat it again, and again…

Anyone else experienced the same issues with NTI Backup Now EZ 4? Can anyone illuminate or help me? Thank you.

My overall ratings:
Toshiba Canvio Connect II 1TB Portable Hard Drive: 9 (out of 10)
NTI Backup Now EZ 4: 4 out of 10.
Pogoplug PC: Of no use to me.

Ion Saliu

author: Mom of 2 Boys
title: No longer works
content: No longer works, bought because of great reviews to store old photos. Used once and just went to add more photos recovered from an old computer and it doesn't work. Very disappointed and now my pictures are gone. I don't recommend this product

author: Donna M.
title: This was perfect for travel
content: This was perfect for travel.  I used it to download photos from our cameras on a once in a lifetime trip to Greece.  It was fast enough for me, uploaded 300-400 photos each evening and it only took a couple of minutes at the most. So far so good. I downloaded first to a mac book then to this hard drive.

author: Burney Cain

author: Will

content: Have been a WD fan for over 20 years. Due to the good User Reviews and badly failure of my last 2-years old WD, I'm trying this Toshiba. content:
These little guys are great. They are super quiet and do the job. On my Mac, you can easily drag/drop files from your internal hard drive or another external drive to the other. However, I have not figured out how to set a password or secure it. So Toshiba, if you're reading, how do you do that on a Mac. (The security software is for Windows.)

author: Movie Fan
title: 5/17/18 update - Buyer beware.  original post - so this fits the bill nicely. I works great and is quite fast
content:
5/17/18 UPDATE.  Sadly, this drive died just 29 months after purchase, which of course is outside of the 2 year warranty.  I am very disappointed that it died so quickly after the warranty ran out.  I have many drives that are still running after almost 10 years of daily service and only had a 2 year warranty.  Luckily for us, it was only used for portable use of files and not for backup. author: Maria Gonzalez

author: Wayde J. Prejean

content: I am using it to back up one of my Win 10 computers.  It works well for my use.  I probably won't be traveling with it much, but if it did it is very compact.

author: John Zabinski

author: Michael C. Morgan
title: Wished I would have bought sooner
content:
I noticed my Mac going slow so I bought this just in case.  I lucked out and it put a full backup of my mac on it just 2 days before my Mac crashed.  So when I got the hard drive on the Mac replaced at the Apple store and started with default settings, I was able to upload all of my stuff back on the mac just like "it never happened." This is my first external hard drive so I'm not sure what's "normal" but I feel like the instructions to set it up weren't accurate/clear. author: Peter Moss

author: BBudman
title: Toshiba Canvio Advance 3TB External HD USB 3.0
content: I've been using Toshiba external HD's for at least 5 years. They are very reliable and contain basic backup software. After major update went bad on my laptop (Windows 10) and was hanging up in boot-up. Safe mode did not work either. I decided to do a full restore from my Toshiba drive. Took about 2 1/2 hours but after it completed I was able to boot up and run with no problems. Lost some e-mails but all else worked well. I do full back-ups every 2-3 weeks and before any major updates. This drive saved me a lot of grief. PS invest in good back-up software like NTI Backup Now EZ which I use.

author: Jutsinger
title: Great for my MacBook.

I plugged it in and the MacBook automatically formatted it and started the backup process.  I am very impressed how fast it backed up my computer.  It's also nice and small.

author: Norm
title: Always says DISK NOT EJECTED PROPERLY when I am not even anywhere near the computer
content:
DO NOT BUY THIS DRIVE or anything else made by Toshiba.

 I had it two weeks. I am not even touching the drive or near my computer and I get DISK NOT EJECTED PROPERLY errors. Sometimes while connected the drive disappears from the computer (Finder on my Mac) but continues to appear to operate.

The Warranty is USELESS. This is a portable drive and I am traveling outside the United States. They won't even replace the drive or the cable. author: Andres T.
title: Stopped working after 6 months
content: Used hardrive for only 6 months and it stopped working. Had it connected to my PS4 for extra storage, lost all of my game data. Device is still under warranty but warranty replacement is so complicated and takes so long that it's not even worth doing. Will never buy again and would not recommend.

author: jbdean
title: Works like a charm!
content: I LOVE it! My local electronics chain had this for the same price for 1T! It hasn't given me a moment's of trouble with my 2011 iMac running El Capitain and I feel so much better knowing I have a slew of space to keep my Time Machine backup on. And it's so tiny! One day our phones with have this much memory!! :-)

author: kevin rolf
title: Avoid at all costs if you value your data!!!
content: Absolute garbage. I used this as a recovery disk and the drive failed. As in all of my irreplaceable data is forever lost. Toshiba customer service is cold and awful. They refuse to pay for data recovery. I will never again buy a Toshiba product and I will go out of my way to tell everyone to avoid buying their products. This will not be the last poor review I post about them.

author: Bim Bousman
title: Rating the Toshiba external hard drive
content: It is really impossible to rate a disk drive before you find out how long it is going to last.

author: Elianet Semanat
title: Best Drive
content: I have to say that Toshiba is not only the best TV brand. This brand has been durable and long-lasting.  This was my 3rd purchase. I recommend this drive to everyone.

author: A. Reyes
title: Excellent product
content: A few months using thus and working good

author: cmend
title: It shipped immediately and is nice and compact
content:
It shipped immediately and is nice and compact.
I must have not understood that when backing up files from my Mac and preparing them for my son to be compatible with both his Mac and PC, I had to format separate drives for the different file types and copy them twice. I wish it was clear in the advertising description that you have to do some set up to accommodate both formats and both systems for the end use.  Not everyone is so computer savvy.

author: Elias
title: Absolute Worse External HD I've Used
content:
This has to be the absolute worse External HD ive ever used. It is constantly locking up to the point where the HD inside is constantly running but I am unable to stop it or use during this. To open up a picture, video, or open a folder it takes time like it needs to think about it's life and if it has a purpose. Constantly stops from working while im using Premiere. Files have been lost more times this week then ive ever had with ANY OTHER external. STAY AWAY STAY AWAY STAY AWAY! I got what i paid for....dont make my mistake.

I am a heavy user of externals and i need as much storage as possible but yo boi aint rolling in Scrooge McDuck monies.

So, if there's any other suckers like me that bought this, did u find any solutions (besides throwing it in a dumpster) to stop it from doing this and speeding up its ability to do anything? Thank you in advised.

author: Janet
title: Just love it
content: After a computer crash I knew I needed a newer back up. I was a little concerned about the small size but it is large capacity in a small package.  For the most part I just leave it in place but the few times I have needed to take information with me...it has been great to carry and connect elsewhere.

author: christian
title: I formated it to exFat and like i said all the hard drives i bought from ...
content: Works geat! Recently I had a lot of issues with adata hard drives which i could not open anymore with my bluray player. I formated it to exFat and like i said all the hard drives i bought from adata could not be opened. This Toshiba hard drive works just fine with its rapid usb 3.0 connection. I will buy this brand again for sure.

author: Dope Dennis
title: DON'T BUY! Click of Death for NO Reason
content:
This was good for the first few months. I used the external hard drive as a backup drive for my Mac along with extra storage since it was 2TB and my mac only has 256 GB. It worked well, I plugged it in when I use my Mac at home and SAFELY eject the drive before unplugging it because I knew it could cause damage to it otherwise. However, today upon writing this review the drive glitched up and my mac notified me saying "Toshiba was not properly ejected" and then this "click of death" came upon it randomly. I don't understand how it came to be because I haven't done anything with this hard drive to cause such an issue.

UPDATE*:
That issue was due to a lack of power needed to start the drive. I used a different USB pluggin with a higher voltage and it started to work well!

author: Mike T
title: Bad - NTI Backup now EZ crashes
content:
NTI Backup now EZ crashes repeatedly on Windows 8.1 when trying to start a backup because of the following errors:
***CreateWaitableTimer failed! ErrorCode: 0 Scheduler.cpp:649
+++OpenEvent Failed! ErrorCode=2 ScheduleService.cpp:77
I tried modifying the UAC settings, but it didn't help. A lot of users say that they have encountered similar issues with NTI software. This is an ongoing issue that hasn't been taken care of in a very long time (years). It virtually renders the backup software unusable and I am not willing to pay extra to buy another backup software suite separately. I have contacted Toshiba and NTI to get help with these issues.
The drive itself seems nice.
I will change the rating when the issue is solved.
Thanks.

author: Marilyn
title: A Gift
content: I bought this for my husband.He uses it for his PS 4 as an external storage.He said it was easy to install & format it on his PS 4. He hopes this will last much longer than the former external drive. The other "Name" brand he had just went dead.

author: Amazon Customer
title: A lot of space that doesn't take up a lot of space.
content:
I purchased this hard drive to back up my personal lap top which is out of drive space; my laptop is old and slow and I was pleasantly surprised at how quickly the Toshiba Canvio Connect II 1TB Portable Hard drive was able to transfer files. My files consist primarily of large file size photographs, documents, music, and other basic files.

I am consider myself to be an intermediate tech user, I'm not hugely tech savvy but I know a thing or 2, and I was impressed by what you get for your money with this unit, it's a lot of space for not a lot of money and the whole thing fits in the palm of your hand. I would definitely recommend.

author: Dick Conrad
title: Love this!
content: I bought this on World Backup Day and am so pleased with the quality for the value. It was super easy to set up and I was able to even schedule backups for times that are convenient for me. Now I feel secure knowing my computer is backed up if I ever have a crash. Win!

author: Aram Sinnreich
title: Died in less than a year
content: I entrusted my entire photo library, as well as my professional music archives, to this hunk of junk and now, less than eight months later, the HD is dead and won't mount properly on my laptop. I am furious and devastated. Spend your money elsewhere, if you value your data.

author: Mike C
title: And I would also like to say I have 2 and on my 75" ...
content: This product is superb. And I would also like to say I have 2 and on my 75" Sharp 4k uhd tv with both connected and filled to the max with movies, music and tv shows... they both show up in with all data present and readable, playing with no glitches whatsoever!!!

author: Deanna Lormand
title: Easy to use, sleek, tons of space!
content:
I bought this to free up space on my hard drive due to thousands and thousands of pictures I had.  This little device not only stored all of my pictures, videos and documents, but I was able to add all of the pictures from my husbands computer as well. I still have lots more room for thousands more pictures.  The price is great for the 1 TB hard drive and it has a sleek design.  I got it in red. It's small and won't take up a lot of space like the old external hard drives used to.
The USB is about a foot long and worked perfectly for my purposes.  The install was super easy.  I plugged it in and was almost immediately able to transfer my files.
Accessing your files from the portable hard drive is easy as well.  I am not tech savvy but this was very easy.

author: Brandi Schmidt
title: Terrible!
content: Do not buy this if you ever want to see your files again! After a month it just stopped working. I can't get any computer or laptop to recognize the device and I can't get to my files.

author: KB
title: NOT compatible with iOS or Macbooks
content: Don't believe what it says about compatibility "with formatting" for iOS or Macbooks. Total lie. It would NOT work on my laptop, and I couldn't return it because I didn't open it until after the return window expired. I spent over an hour total on the phone with Amazon "Help" and then the "tech support" line they forwarded me to that no one answered - I hung up after being on hold for 42 minutes listening to music the periodic messages about how "your call is important to us." Waste of money.

author: Eugene M. Smith
title: System won't restart with drive connected
content: I bought 2 of these and use them with Windows 10 pro. The y work to store and retrieve data. However, if I try a Windows restart for the computer, the system hangs up. If I use physical on/off, the system seems eventually to boot up. Both drives have a similar performance issue. I tried them on a second computer by a different manufactuer, and get the same response. If I remove the drive the system them works fine. Tech support does not respond.

author: cannonnt
title: I'm surprised by how many components this hard drive isn't ...
content: I'm surprised by how many components this hard drive isn't compatible with, but it works at it's base function as a storage device for my music and movies. Was really hoping to put my music library in one place for my car but the search continues

author: ArvadaDude
title: Bargain and works great!
content: So far this drive has worked as a back up.  I had a drive recovered from a damaged drive and installed on this drive and no problems.  I am also adding to it daily as a back up drive for my new computer.  Works fast, easy to use, compact and no problems!  For the money, I'm very impressed as this wasn't the most expensive 1TB drive I could have got.  It isn't a solid state drive, but for now I'm happy.

author: Darrell Keim
title: Didn't work long.
content: Broke after less than a year.

author: Timothy G.
title: Simple, solid, and big enough!
content:
Simple, solid, and big enough!  I wanted something my bride could easily attach to her tablet to offload videos and photos related to her hobby, without me getting involved.  The old 250gb portable was out of space...

This worked!  Much more capacity, simple connectivity, easy to use with simple drag-n-drop under Windows 10, and easy to stash away when not in use.  Need to share content?  It's USB!

author: Nikki Chavez
title: If it doesn't fry on you it's a good external hdd
content: Worked great for about 7 months and then it fried. Customer support is non-existent because the company that your directed to is no longer associated with Toshiba.

author: JON MEREDITH
title: An easy, fast and simple exterior hard drive
content: This exterior compact 2TB hard drive is excellent as a working unit, and for a backup unit.  It is a simple as a plug and play to use.  The unit comes with the address for the software that is made for this hard drive that is simple and complete.  It is portable, of course.  For me, it is an engineer's delight!

author: MikeMisty Baltimore
title: Pleased with purchase.
content: I bought this as a gift for my wife and she is very pleased with this hard drive.  It has more than enough storage capacity and the price was too good to pass up.  Plus she loves Toshiba products, swears by Toshiba laptops.  Great purchase through Amazon.

author: Lil Sarg
title: This is a very nice Portable HD
content: This is a very nice Portable HD. It is very small which I like as well. Toshiba is a good brand. It was worth the $. I would suggest though that if you are going to back up more than one pc and other things such as usb flash drives, phones and sd cards from cameras, it wdnt be a bad idea to get a 2TB. It is cheaper to buy a 2TB now than to buy another portable HD later.

author: Dariel Aquino
title: The best hard drive brand ever!
content: Me and my brother have been using this brand for almost 10 years now and it’s just the best. We use 10 of them in a daily basis and they work great. Some of them will brake but the warranty service is awesome. I’ll keep buying then and I say thanks to Toshiba for been there for us.

author: Michael Flynn
title: Functions just like your computers hard drive
content: Plug and play. Plug it into an USB3 port and transfers are real fast. Backwards compatible with older USB ports. Functions just like your computers hard drive. Back up everything, pictures, music, videos and movies, documents, anything.

author: sleep4aliving
title: Works great
content: Great HD and has worked great over last few months. Who cares about color buy the cheap color for same product

author: Andrew RM
title: Ideal backup drive.
content: I used this to replace a dying drive I used as my Time Machine on my Mac. The process of copying the original drive took 12 plus hours  and I had to restart several times. I was worried I would kill the drive immediately. But it went fine. Being powered by USB avoids even more cables. It's virtually silent. It is small enough to hide behind the stand of my Mac.

author: NDakotan
title: Great Product But TEST it First.
content: Was extremely easy to use and backed up almost 1TB of data in a short time span.  However I got a defective one and computer expert stated data was corrupt.  Amazon replaced it quickly.  Daughter has same type just smaller version and it works beautifully.  Believe that my bad one is a fluke.  Test the drive prior to storing data so you don't lose anything important.  Thankfully the computer expert was able to get all the data I had put on it from my original computer. Will give updated review of replaced product.

author: Mary Beth Wilson
title: Bought two. Both of them were defective on arrival.
content:
I bought two of these canvio advance 1tb HDD's at the same time.  One black and one white.  BOTH were defective upon arrival. Both would not spin up, both were clicking like the heads were bad.

Never got to use either of them.. which is probably a very good thing.

This is ridiculous. Returning Immediately.

author: RecklessAbandon
title: Love it.  Would buy again if needed.
content: Love it! Came quickly and exactly as described. Had no trouble with plug and play, and it loaded files quickly. It's really small, it's amazing 2TB can fit in this small drive. Very easily portable. And the red color is very pretty.

author: Super Seven
title: It worked great, and was surprisingly fast with the data transfer
content: It worked great, and was surprisingly fast with the data transfer.  Remember to change your sleep settings on your computer prior to backing up your PC, or it may not finish its job.

author: Jaime Rosado
title: If it failed on you, PLEASE READ
content: This hard drive is NOT entirely portable! You can't take it everywhere because you run the risk of potentially breaking it. And you would break it and not even notice. I've had mine for almost a month now and it hasn't failed on me, because I took care of it. The worst thing that happens is that it occasionally skips, but that's ALL that happens. I do not recommend it for taking anywhere with you if you'll be moving a lot. But I DO recommend it for simple usage (so far I've used 300GB on it and its still pulling strong, even after one drop). It's good for the price, although it is cheaply made. Just keep it at home or something and it'll last much longer

author: Nobody
title: Reliable external storage!
content: I purchased this because of the ratings. This product does not disappoint. I am using it as external storage for my Blu-Ray player and it works flawlessly. Plenty of storage for videos. I am able to hook it up to my PC, copy whatever over to it, move it to the Blu-Ray and all works great!

author: JWPerkins
title: Using with Monument
content: Used as the two devices plugged into the Monument photo storage device; works great so far with no issues! A great value and find for the cost. Really happy so far.

author: AmazonCustomer
title: to good to be true
content: seller selling out dated product which when went to download driver for it from Toshiba, this product is no longer supported by them..and to get a driver that might work from Microsoft, would cost an additional $95.00. for a driver update program..hard to do when you live on disability!

author: Ray
title: For what I need this is awesome for the price
content: I bought this simply to backup years worth of photos and video so that it could stored in a different area in the event my computer failed, and for those massive video files that are way too large to upload. I am very happy with the one terabyte version I bought for $53. Keep in mind that it does not have a power supply and runs solely off of the USB port. On my computer using USB 3 it transfers at about 25 megabytes per second. It comes with that unusual USB connection that was used for the Samsung Galaxy S5 but I found it also can use a standard micro USB cable although at a slower transfer rate. Luckily I used to own a Samsung S5 so I have several of those unusual cables left that are USB 3 compliant. For what I need and the price you can't go wrong. Unlike other people who have reviewed this product I had no problem plugging it in and having Windows 10 recognize it immediately allowing me simply to drag files onto this little hard drive.

author: abu3mrh
title: Its works perfectly with the ps4 better than any other hard drive.
content: Very very good it has been 6 months and its works perfectly I use it for my ps4 good writing and good reading also its got disconnected multiple tines and its still works with no problems at all. I planning to get another from the same brand with bigger capacity. Its works perfectly with the ps4 better than any other hard drive I have tried.

author: Kevin Fitzpatrick
title: Good so far
content: So far so good. Using it on xbox one. No lag in game loading/playing.

author: Pumbala
title: Piece of Crap
content: Didn't have the drive long enough to see if it was any good as hardware - but if you buy one, IMMEDIATELY FORMAT IT.  This drive comes with built-in backup software which is an absolute disaster.  You can only recover the backup by plugging the drive in and booting the computer - but mine never booted.  Absolutely zero support from Toshiba or NPI (the software maker), so I lost EVERYTHING that I backed up.

author: Mikeakon
title: no warranty for 90 days?
content: This 2tb external hard drive has lost data and now pings.  I bought this in September based on the reviews.  I bought this to store precious photos.

author: Jonathon Earl
title: These are the best external hard drives! I've been using these for the past 7 years!
content: These Toshiba Canvio external hard drives are the best! No ac adaptor required, just simply plug and play via USB to PC or laptop. I've been using these for the past 7 years with proper care! Always eject the hard drive before unplugging unless your computer is powered off. It is very important to use the Safely Remove Hardware and Eject Media icon usually at the bottom right-hand corner of the desktop screen to keep from damaging the storage device. Works great!

author: Elizabeth Willner
title: cord did not work right out of the box
content: I borrowed a cord from another Toshiba drive and with that other cord the drive was plug and play (I have a Mac, but I also have my own copy of Tuxera, which reads NTFS for the Mac).  The cord that came in the box seems to provide power but does not seem to transfer data or cannot communicate with the computer.  The cord appears flexible enough for my purposes, if it worked.  It is short, about 18 inches between the two plugs (not including the plugs).

author: Felix Lewis
title: Setup and forget about it
content: I have 3 of this type now. Trouble free on my latest model iMac.

author: One old lady
title: Lifesaver hard drive backup
content: Compact plug and play. You can back up many devices in a flash. Fits in pocket. Very portable and easy to transfer data fikes to another device. So easy non- techy user found surprisingly easy to use

author: Amy
title: Disappointed longtime customer
content: I got this product a few days ago and started using it. It unfortunately is already having issues with the computer finding it. I am afraid to put anything on the drive for fear it will all be lost. This is a shame, I have 4 other Toshiba external hard drives I have bought and had not one problem. This was a 90 dollar product and a waste of my money. I don't have 90 dollars to throw around so this not working properly has really upset me.

author: McLJ
title: Unreliable
content:
This is the second Toshiba 2TB external hard drive I have purchased.  The first lasted about 6 months.  I contacted Toshiba and returned it under warranty.  I assumed it was a fluke, and because I liked the size of the drive I bought another.  This second drive failed in 10 days.  I'm not sure what the issue is, but I'm not interested in trying a third.

Sadly, the requirements for returning the product under warranty are far more stringent that how it was shipped to me, and a refund takes up to 6 weeks.  I'm still waiting for the refund on the first drive.  Very disappointed.

author: Megan
title: Just a decent harddrive
content:
Works pretty well! It's hard to mess up badly with a harddrive. Unfortunately, it does use a pretty obscure cable that unplugs pretty easily, but that's the one of the only real problems with the harddrive.

Other than that, it's just a little awkward to use on a Mac. Not impossible, but extra steps.

author: Shopper in New Castle
title: Very disappointed
content: This drive only lasted 6 months, we lost everything saved on the drive.

author: G. Vignes
title: I've purchased 4 of these Toshiba Canvio drives in the past 6 months
content: UPDATE: I've purchased 4 of these Toshiba Canvio drives in the past 6 months. My financial situation allowing, I will probably purchase several more. They are excellent, very compact, very fast, very cool and very easy to use. They have great colors too. I previously used a combination of flash drives and DVDs, but now I've switched to these external hard drives. If you do the math, you will find that these drivers are cheaper, faster and much simpler to use. These drives run NTFS, which works fine with Ubuntu as well as Windows. There is no need to reformat for Linux.

author: N. Carpenter
title: Good Performer
content: Have other Toshiba external storage devices which performed very well.  Which is why I bought this storage device.  Fires up immediately when attached to your PC or notebook.  No regrets.  Happy.

author: "Loopydloop"
title: Right price. Good reviews. Performs well. For now.
content: I bought this because the price was right, I could get it fast and it was rated relatively high compared to others. So far it has performed well, transfers quickly and I am happy with the purchase. Of course, as we know, this could change in a millisecond. But at this moment I have no problems.

author: Pelican Kate
title: So far so good. I'm a skeptic when it comes to external ...
content: So far so good.  I'm a skeptic when it comes to external hard drives, having had several crash at various stages of life.  This drive is nice and compact and worked well for me while I vacationed in the tropics.  The conditions there were hot and humid with no a/c.  My laptop did shut down in the humidity, but this drive held up. (My laptop recovered later). I give this device 4 stars because of that.  I reserve the 5th star for longevity.

author: jason
title: Great buy
content: Lite weight fast and massive storage. Just plu it in and start using it.

author: Aota
title: Can’t go wrong with these at this price !
content: Excellent plug-and-play storage.

author: I. Santamaria
title: Unreliable
content:
Update: trying to use the hard drive with a different computer.  Security software doesn't run.  Clicking the .exe will begin an install but the software itself doesn't run even after restarting.
Result: my files are not accessible.

Original review:
Sometimes, when connecting the hard drive, the security software won't start automatically.
If I try to run it manually, it will open just to say that it can't work "because the required service program has not started."  It gives no hint about what services should I look for or anything.  So I'm getting stuck without access to my files.
In those cases, restarting the computer might help.  Not always.

author: SarahX727
title: and was super easy to set up
content:
No issues at all. I'm using it on my mac, and was super easy to set up.
I love that it's password protect... makes me regret ever having got a hard drive that wasn't.
(because I have no idea where some of them are...)

I'd recommend it to a friend... and I actually literally just recommended it to my sister.

author: Barry
title: Perfect companion for my solid state drive laptop
content: Perfect companion for my solid state drive laptop. Its fast and compact. It fits in my laptop carrying case along with all the other things I carry. 1TB is an impressive amount of storage for the physical size.

author: riverguy
title: It works, for now.
content: This drive replaces one from a different, but major, manufacturer.  The old one failed after about an hour of use and in a very critical situation that lost me years of valuable data.  And that wasn't the first failure of a similar external drive, either.  So now I have all of my data backed up on three of them, all different manufacturers, and I'm hoping that will cover me.  It seems ironic somehow that when I spend hours reading reviews on things like this, there are NONE that come through well.  They all have lousy reviews, so what one needs to do is to pick the one with the least lousy reviews, and in buying a backup drive, that's not exactly a confidence builder.  So time will tell on this one.  For now, it works great.  Just like the last one . . .

author: Ms B
title: I don't like it
content: I thought this would be the type of drive that I can easily access the data that I put on it between my 2 laptops but I can't. I needed to be able to copy and access data I stored on this drive. I have no use for it.

author: Robert Freund
title: slow
content:
The package arrived in good shape , the packing is good.  I was going to use the drive for  Images and video.  However it is slow to wake up and impossible to edit / watch videos from it. Sluggish is the keyword . As a backup device it is probably ok, but as a work drive no so much.
Aspire V 15 nitro - black editions windows 10 , Adobe premiere, bridge, photoshop.

author: Pano
title: So far, so good. Both MAC and Windows.
content:
I've only had this a few months, but it's been a champ.  Fast enough for me and it allows me to carry all my files where ever I go.
I reformatted to EXFAT and use this with both Windows10 and MAC OSX. Handy that mine came with a USB-C cable, too.

author: ChiliDog
title: LOVE THIS DRIVE / NOW OWN TWO
content: THIS IS A SOLID PRODUCT FOR THE MONEY. THIS WAS MY 2ND. BUYING ONE FOR THE WIFE (MOTHERS DAY) FOR HER MUSIC COLLECTION.  I DO RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT FOR THE PRICE.

author: KILL_DOGG
title: Good HDD for the money
content: This is a very solid HDD.  I immediately filled this with files and was impressed with the write speed.  Playing movies directly from the device is streaming flawlessly.  I can't comment on the longevity of the product yet, but so far I have been please with the performance.  I did get rid of all the bloatware included on it, so that's my only nit pick.

author: John Dunton
title: Fast delivery..
content: You can not drag and drop in .

author: mesa az
title: Finally started the test
content:
Update 5 am Wednesday  I finally got the drive to run the Toshiba diagnostics. Not really sure how I tried another manufactures diagnostics as I saw it would work in a form. And then after that the Toshiba diagnostics worked and it’s running the long test right now it’s gonna take a few hours

I’ve been trying to find disk diagnostics for two hours. It tells you to put in a part number, model number, serial number every time I do it takes me to the TV support page. I don’t have a TV. And then you have to know exactly which model of the drive you have there’s several different versions. I’ve got all that figured out and I still cannot find it. Whenever I buy a hard drive either new or recertify always run the long extended diagnostic test on it. I have the Toshiba software but it’s two years old it came with a different drive. I cannot get it to work on this drive I’m trying to download a new version and I cannot find it anywhere. Very frustrating

author: Javier Ferrer
title: Handy
content: I have enjoyed this portable drive for almost half a year and it has worked perfectly. No lag, no errors. I am subtracting a star as it's not as fast as my other portable hard drive, even though there are both supposed to work in the same league. And it feels very plastic, but it would be irresponsible to declare it is made of bad material as I have not had any trouble. No falls, though.

author: Ph3nom001
title: Excitement tuned into disappointment.
content: Was using this hard drive as a PS4 backup. Failed after 3 months. Disappointed.

author: Isaac
title: The Backup Solution You Have Been Looking For
content: Easy to setup and use! Nice sleek black design. Provides plenty of space for backup depending on how much data you need to backup; please always check the amount of space used on each drive on your computer system.

author: Luis Vizcaya
title: Muy bueno
content: Tiene una capacidad de 930gb disponible, fácil de instalar y muy portable por su tamaño pequeño

author: Forensic Team
title: Very Slow
content:
It's fast copying text files, but very very very slow copying images and videos.
If you have money, get the SSD.

author: Old Amazon Customer
title: Having connection issues, probably from the cable
content: Seems like the cable does not connect quite right, so I'm having connection issues. When I get it to work, I need to make sure I don't bump it at all or turn it off. I'm using it with my Channel Master TV recording device.

author: Poohscorner74
title: GREAT STORAGE
content: This is great for storing all your pics and documents for safe keeping. It's small enough to grab it you have to leave in a hurry and still have your pics and documents with you.

author: Ruby R.
title: With light use, this drive failed completey within 4 ...
content: With light use, this drive failed completey within 4 months of purchase. All data lost, and the drive cannot be repaired on either Windows or Mac. Note that Toshiba's warranty DOES NOT cover your data, and they are difficult to work with (unwilling to allow for warranty). DO NOT BUY THIS DRIVE. BUY A DRIVE FROM SOMEONE OTHER THAN TOSHIBA.

author: lux4rd0
title: Works as expected... still getting USB disconnects.
content: Works as expected but having a lot of disconnects and resets with this drive (which I've never experienced with other USB devices.) Hard to tell if this is a drive issue or a computer/USB hub issue. Need to do some more troubleshooting to confirm. Nice that it's completely hub powered - don't need another power cord running with my Intel NUC.

author: TRJ
title: Two-days old, loaded with backups, now can't access, no customer svc available...

title: This is one of the best purchases I’ve ever made!
content: I have many important files on my computer. I would regularly backup my computer, usually on thumb drives. When I received it, all I had to do was connect the USB cable to the hard drive, plug it into my computer, and I was good to go. I have even unplugged it from one computer and immediately plugged it into another computer I own, and it works seamlessly. Even though it comes in many colors, I chose gloss black to match my other electronic items. It is the size of a deck of cards and fits nicely in a shirt pocket or in a pocket in my purse.
