author: NC Mom
title: Fast, Quiet, Efficient File Backups
content:
I purchased this external hard drive for use in my home office.  I do voice over work and needed to store back up copies of large audio projects. I researched several models before deciding on the Toshiba Canvio Connect.  I paid full price (ok, my boss reimbursed me, so technically my boss paid full price) and it is worth every penny.

So far I love everything about this hard drive.  The drive is small and super portable.  It weighs about 8oz and it measures just over 4 inches by 3 inches by less than one inch.  You can easily tuck into your jacket pocket or backpack.  (I bought a case for it for extra protection, so in practice the drive is a little bulkier than its direct measurements).  But you don’t have to transport it, because with a minimum amount of work, you can access it remotely!

Here are the really great things that convinced me on this Toshiba external drive:
1.  Cloud-based automatic backup.  Super easy and secure.  You don’t have to think about it, just set it up and let it do its thing.
2.  Password protected data encryption.  I’m pretty sure no hacker is going to try to steal my voice overs, but my boss is paranoid about security.
3.  Content sharing.  There is a free software download that lets you connect and upload / download from other devices.  This is really good because my co workers are scattered all over and we all have home offices.  My boss and coworkers can access my work  product even if I’m not available to send it to them.
4.  Plug and play.  The drive is  formatted and ready to go when you receive it.  If all you want is a simple, no bells and whistles external drive, then you don’t need to do any of the cloud stuff.  Just plug in the drive and you are done.
5.  Two Terabytes.  No kidding.  I remember when one gigabyte was huge.  It’s gonna take a while to fill this up.
6.  It's red.  I love red.  It is easier to find in the bottom of your bag or in a pile of clutter on your desk.  Plus red just makes me  happy.
7.  It runs fast and it runs cool.  I routinely back up 10GB projects with no fuss, muss, or hassle.  I just copy, paste, and boom my file is backed up and I'm back in business.

author: Irrintra
title: No Hard Drive Lasts Forever.
content:
No hard drive lasts forever; that should be the mantra of everyone that sells these things.

If I had to recommend as a computer technician whether to buy laptop or desktop-sized external hard drives, I'd go with the former. The laptop drives are designed for travel and have a bit of tolerance for turbulence. Desktop drives are meant to stay in one place and move very infrequently, not to mention discourage portability with their bulkiness and power via power outlet.

This external came with some "cloud" software brand new, but I haven't messed with it at all. It works much like you'd expect if you've used these things before. You plug it in, your operating system sees it and does what it can to allow you to manipulate the data on the device.

Just make sure that you have a second one to backup your stuff to or use cloud storage for the most critical of data. It helps when I follow my own advice too.

author: Diego
title: Works well and looks great - read for Apple/Windows compatibility
content:
I bought this for my sister. In terms of size and looks, this is a winner.
In terms of speed, I've used it with USB 3.0 in my laptop and it was pretty fast.
If you need a hard drive to carry work around or as a backup, this seems to fit the bill pretty well.
My experience with hard drives is that you cannot tell in advance how well they will hold over time, so I have nothing to say with respect to reliability.

Update: my sister needed to be able to transfer files between a Mac and a Windows PC. In order to do that, you will have to re-format the drive as it comes formatted with a format that is not writeable on a Mac. The format you need is ExFAT, and  from what I have read, it needs to be done on a Windows PC or it will not be compatible on both sides. To format the drive, connect it to a windows PC and do the following:
1) Open up Windows Explorer and right-click on your drive in the sidebar. Choose "Format".
2) In the "File System" dropdown, choose exFAT instead of NTFS.
3) Click Start and close this window when finished.
Your drive should now be usable on Mac and PC without limitations!

UPDATE: Some comments after reading other reviews. Hope this helps you...
* NEVER use a single hard drive as a backup. They fail unpredictably! I've had hard drives that worked for years and others that broke quickly. The same manufacturer can have batches with different quality. If you are going to be using a hard drive like this to backup your files, I suggest getting more than one.
* Don't use cheap backup software included with a hard drive. Use Time machine on MacOS or Windows file history on Windows. They work well and are free. If your needs are more complicated, then look at the first bullet and buy better backup software.
* For photos and videos, besides backing them up on a hard drive, I upload them to Google Photos (free) and Amazon Prime photos (free with prime for photos only). These are very important for me, so I like having extra copies.
* For music, you can backup your library using iTunes backup (if you have it on iTunes) for $25/year.
* For other important documents, you should use a cloud drive for backup. Unless you do specialized work, the rest of your data should not be that big.

author: PJS
title: Be cautious about compatibility with systems other than Windows.
content:
This is an inexpensive and very compact drive. Worked fine directly connected to USB 3 ports on two Windows 7 notebooks I have.
Unfortunately my target device was not Windows. As a standards based USB device using NTFS there is no theoretical reason it is not plug and play anywhere those devices can connect. Well, it was not recognized at all by the pogoplug storage server where I needed it.
Internet search for help produced lots of feedback to people with Macs who had struggled, but the only Toshiba site help request similar to mine had gone unanswered for over a year. So I guess I will just ebay mine or save it for some Windows-specific project.
In fairness... it is cheap. If you want it for Windows, go for it!
As a side note, there is no useful documentation included with the drive. (well, since is should be plug-and-play USB, why would documentation be needed?) But Toshiba has placed some software on the drive for you to load on your Windows box. There is no "readme" or other indication about the purpose of the software. (As I have said, on Windows you don't need any software to use it).
I thought that perhaps starting the "setup" executable would display some sort of banner or message to indicate software's purpose.
Nothing.
I cancelled the installation. There are enough companies out there who want to put mysterious executables on your computer.
I don't install unidentified software with no clear purpose.

In a couple of days, it began to fail (stopped writing, kept locking up, etc).  I figured it was just an anomaly, so I ordered another and accepted the loss.  I received the 2nd drive the next day on Amazon (end of September).  I transferred all of the data from the other failing drive and began using the new one for backup and storage.  Today is Nov 16th (less than 2 months later), and this drive is having the exact same issue (clicking, fails when trying to save files, locking up, etc).  I ran the Mac Disk Utility on it several times, and I get a message that indicated the drive could not be unmounted.  I've worked with enough external hard drives to know it is about to fail.  I just ordered a Western Digital MyPassport to replace this one.  If that one fails, then I will update this review - assuming the problem is not the drives.  But the clicking noises are usually a pretty good sign that something isn't right.  I certainly would never trust a hard drive backup that had clicking noises - especially when they correlate with demonstrable read/write issues.  I'm no expert - but that has been my experience.

I had to put the drive in front of a fan, and pause writes every minute, for a minute, before I saw stable throughput speeds from the drive.

I'm using f3write to verify the drive before I trust it with my data. It eventually passed read/write tests for all 2TB.

author: A. User
title: What You Need to Know About Portable Hard Drives
content:
There's a lot of nonsense in the reviews, so I'm going to give you some facts. Feel free to do some research to verify what I'm saying. This is already a wall of text so I won't go into too much detail.
1) EVERY hard drive manufacturer has failures. EVERY last one. Some are DOA, some take a month or more. It depends on your use. You've heard of 6-Sigma? That's about 3.4 failures per million. Do the math.
1b) Any drive you research (unless it was just released) will have more bad reviews than good. Why? Because people are more likely to complain than praise.
1c) Smaller manufacturers get bought out by larger ones. Last year's high-end product may now harbor a low-end drive. Seriously. CYA. Find manufacturers you trust and give them your loyalty.
2) Every USB hard drive, thumb drive, etc. works on Windows, Mac and Linux. There are a few specialty proprietary devices, especially for professional and enterprise equipment, but consumer equipment works on both. Reformat it if you need to. Check it on all your devices before using it (technical reasons).
2b) ExFAT is the usual suspect for cross-platform file sharing. It's not great. It has nothing to hinder data loss (like journaling) and, in my experience, Macs sometimes choke on it. Consider a reputable cross-platform file driver and stick with NTFS or HFS+. Check your drive on all the platforms before using it (technical reasons). If you're using it for backups, only use it for backups. If it's for TimeMachine on a Mac, let TimeMachine reformat it and take it over completely.
2c) Check the options when you buy it and check again in your cart. There are multiple sizes, styles and "support" options. Make sure you're ordering what you think you are. Seriously. I've seen plenty of reviews by people who are really complaining that they ordered the wrong thing. And watch the price when you change options. Check it again in the cart before you check out.
3) Don't move your data – copy it. And save your old drive until your sure the new one is good. Feel free to abuse your new device, perform surface scans, etc. as often as you want when you get it. It's called a burn in. If the drive's mechanics are good, software will watch for failing sectors later (look up S.M.A.R.T.).
3b) SSDs don't need scans and should not be defragged. It's actually bad for them.
4) Get an online backup service, preferably a reputable one with a zero-knowledge policy, like SpiderOak or Carbonite. That means the provider can't access your data even if they wanted to. It's called security. Hang on to your old drive until your files finish backing up (in case of a failure). Depending on your service, it may not take very long. (Some services check your data to avoid uploading the same data twice.)
5) Electronic equipment, no matter how rugged or solid-state it claims to be, no matter what the ads say, is not intended to be dropped, sat on, magnetized, electrocuted, submerged, burned, microwaved, or implanted into living beings. It's certainly not meant to be thrown, left in the rain, dropped in the pool, etc. You do that and it breaks. You lose data. (Products actually intended for this behavior are expensive. Water resistant is not submersible. Submersible has limits. Shock resistant does not mean it's ok to drop it.)
6) Don't use the included backup software, backup service, or built-in password protection. You are not paying for these things. If they were that good, they would be sold independently. If they are, what you have is an ad designed to trick you into using a service you won't bother to cancel. Get your own service. (See #4.)
6b) The first thing you should do is reformat the drive, even if it came formatted. It doesn't take long. Just do it.
7) Portable is good, but if your laptop comes with an external mouse and keyboard, two external drives, a hub... it's not portable anymore. SD cards are pretty cheap and more durable for travel. They're also faster. Keep your drive safe and bring copies. Unless, of course you need a lot of space. In that case get a second drive and bring copies. If your data is that important, protect it.
8) Think of the stupidest person at your job and assume that every review is written by them. Seriously, I've known professional techs I wouldn't trust to plug in a keyboard. Some of them made a lot of money. I have DECADES of tech experience. I also have a bunch of educational and professional credentials. Of course, I may also be a small pink bunny. You don't know. Don't listen to people on the internet, including me. Look for respected technical sites (I don't think I'm allowed to list any here) and find consensus. Ask what the worst outcome is if the writer is a moron or troll.
9) When checking the reviews, check what the 1-star reviews say. Are they bitter or factual? Drives fail? Did the company treat them well? Are they actually complaining about Amazon or a 3rd party seller?
9b) 12% of the reviews here are 1-star. A quick survey shows me at least half of them are by people that don't know as much about computers as their friends tell them they do. Half of the rest are actually complaining about other stuff. Toshiba's return policies look like they could use some work though, so use your 30-days to burn it in and back it up.

TLDR I've been using The Toshiba Canvio line since it came out and I still have and use my original drive. I've used them professionally, as have people I know in a variety of fields. I've never had a problem with any of them, neither has anyone I know and when asked for my professional recommendation, it's my go to. Lately, I've been looking for a higher capacity drive (Macs and laptops are port-deprived), but I keep coming back here.

I am a little apprehensive to depend on the drive because of the reviews, so I am planning to back up my important documents and pictures to a separate disk to be safe. I will update this review if the disk fails quickly.

author: Benson
title: Does as it should.
content: Nothing to complain about here, folks. Arrived on my doorstep in time for me to move a bunch of files from one computer to another. No installation or prep work needed; can be used right out of the box for PC's. Comes with the USB wire needed for use.

author: C Mc
title: Works well
content: I have used this to back up content on several computers.  So far no issues.  I'm not using the free software to compress and most of my computers are older with slower USB ports.  Speed is acceptable given the limitations of my equipment.  Good value and convenient size.  I don't cart it around so it stays safely tucked away in a drawer until I run another backup.

author: Earl ADAMS
title: WORKS..
content: EZ Backup Software Works But The Update Button WILL only get you to a spend more money Site..(promises to have a few benefits) if you are willing to Upgrade EZ software to the tune of spend more CA$H..the backup software is confusing (too many options) and (use of) EZ Software documentation is lousy at its best..."Consider this TOSHIBA a Good device" But plan to spend More..

author: SCP
title: Don't buy it if you have a Mac.
content: The worst. I plugged it in and my iMac froze. I had to shut down the power and unplug the drive. Should have given up then. I re-booted and plugged it in again. Froze. One more try. The icon appeared! Great. I installed the software and was instructed to re-boot. From then on, the Mac would go about ¾ of the way through start-up and would shut itself down. So I did a disk erase and restore from my old LaCie back-up, and arranged on Amazon's site to return this cruddy product for a refund. At least that part worked beautifully. I'll pick up a new LaCie (the old backup, which is about 6 years old, started making funny noises, so I replaced it with the Canvio -- big mistake). Maybe this thing works well on PCs, but it's freakin' awful on Macs, with which it says it's compatible.

author: Janice Stanger
title: Most promising hard drive I've had
content: I'm using this hard drive just for back up. Over the years, I've been through two other brands of external hard drives, both of which were difficult to use and stopped working without warning. So far this Toshiba is the easiest to install and use that I've had, it's small and compact. It can be left connected to the laptop, or disconnected and stored until next back up needed. I hope it proves durable, as I like it so far (a couple months in).

author: Sophie
title: Utter piece of crap
content:
What an utter piece of crap. Unfortunately, I moved after I purchased it, so I just opened it and it's past the window to return. I can't save anything to it, because it keeps telling me it's read-only. Other external drives are easy to use. Pretty much plug and play. This one is a ridiculously complicated piece of crap. And don't believe it's Mac-friendly claims. I have a Mac and I've never had problems like this with an external drive. I will NEVER buy this again. NEVER. At least it was on sale when I got it, so I'm only losing $66.99, instead of the $87.99 it's up to now. HUGE WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY.

*Edited to add: Forget the instructions, go into Time Machine, and have Time Machine erase and reformat the drive. That's much easier. However, considering all the problems Mac users have with this P.O.S. drive, (check out all the one-star reviews), you may wind up having a backup that's not readable, or where all your files have been changed to rtf's. I'm using it now, because it's an emergency, and keeping my fingers crossed. But the first thing I'm going to do, the minute I can, is replace this piece of junk with a real drive.

author: Vaclav
title: Bad experience
content:
Until now I had a lot of very good experiences with External Hard Drives from various producers not so known as Toshiba.
This time I decided to buy 2 drives from the reputable company Toshiba.  The first drive stopped working after downloading 140 GB and after formatting, no data was not possible to download. The second drive works very slowly and I am afraid that it will follow the first drive.

author: Em
title: Product destroyed my laptop.
content: After downloading this product onto my laptop my come pewter is no longer running properly. It won’t even stay on for more than five minutes without saying that there are errors and it shutting down. I showed it to my computer guy and he said it was because of downloading this product. I’m very disappointed because I can no longer return it and it has ruined a laptop that cost several thousand dollars.

author: P. Huber
title: Toshiba HDTC910XK3AA ! TB External Hard Drive
content: This gadged worked fine for 8 month. Thereafter it did not work anymore.I will get it replaced since it is in warranty (2 years).

author: Denise Ratliff
title: Toshiba a name you can trust. 2TB external storage, portability a plus
content:
This product was brought to extend my Xbox One S storage capability.  It is a huge 2TB enough for all my gaming needs where I will never run out of storage.  It has a sleek design and very small external hard drive that is a space saver. Toshiba a brand you can trust, fast delivery, great competitive price.

I highly recommend this product.

author: lauren
title: easy to use
content: Purchased 6 months ago because the hard drive on my laptop was nearly full of photos (I'm an amateur/student photographer). No issues to report, has worked well, easy to use, etc. I have kept it in a protective case since I purchased it and have been careful not to drop it or anything, so I don't know how it would hold up to any sort of abuse. My only complaint is that I wish I'd bought one with more than 1TB since I'm running out of room for photos again.

author: BobbyJ
title: Love this Brand of External Hard Drives
content: I hooked this up to my Time Machine on my Apple Mac and it worked fine right from the start.  Love the color.  This is my 3rd Toshiba external hard drive, and I never had a problem with the other 2 older Toshiba drives that I used before this one.  The other 2 still work fine, but I have them secured with saved data and I no longer use them for now.

author: ThommyV
title: Piece of Crap
content: Not compatible with both PC and Mac without formatting...but the worse software I have used in years. The software looks like it is something out of the 1990's....horrible. The product is useless to me

author: Taylor
title: After 9 months of using, I no longer can access the files
content:
All of my files are unaccessable.  I am a graphic designer and I Have lost my whole livelihood.  All of my designs and files are GONE.. I cannot access them... I tried multiple computers and different cords to make sure. I am SO disappointed and furious.
 I thought I was buying a good product with a good company. I do NOT suggest of buying this product until they resolve the issues that they are having with this product.

author: Andrew S
title: Just what I orderd
content: I didn't look at the specs that clearly regarding the size. I was pleasantly surprised when the package came and I unboxed. Plugged it in, opened the drive, clicked the link for the software and I was good to go. Speed's fine, usable space just under 3.7 tb - the download /files take 5.8 GB. I will investigate whats in there. Very happy and saved money one the blue.

author: Micah Pleasant
title: XBOX ONE..Works Great  and Easy!!!
content: Xbox One...this is what I used this great device to store more games and content..its super easy fool proof...You have your Xbox One on plug in side port and bang it recognize the device and ask you to format it..Name the external device takes two second!!1 move files or free up space..I say have console on so you will not be startled when you have it off and cut it on and it doesn't see it for first time..so I had mine on first.. after that it doesn't matter. I love this device add 1Tbite and have plenty of more space and at $49 u cant beat it it works excellent with XBOX ONE!!

author: ductfanman
title: Speed Demon
content: WOW...this is the fastest usb3 harddrive I own. x more than 3.......example Seagate Expansion..35 Toshiba over 100 mps

author: Sean
title: Fine Drive, Unfortunately Bad Security Software.  2.5 stars.
content:
The software for this is really unfortunately designed in that you have to have it installed on any computer you want to unlock it.
I have an older WD drive that is password protected and upon opening it in windows it just prompts you to enter your password, simple, the software is contained on the drive.
For this drive you have to manually install an application on every computer before you can open it up to view files... also for some reason the software has no settings menu you can deselect it from running on startup, you have to disable it via task manager.
I have ended up using it without the software just as a plug'n'play unsecured drive. For that it has worked without issue, however I bought it because it was marketed as a being a password protected drive, so for that I give it a 2.5 stars.

author: Corvo A.
title: Product didn't appear new
content:
Sadly I purchased this item and made sure that I selected the brand new, full price model. After removing it from the Amazon box, there was little packaging, no tape holding anything together, and smear marks/streaks on the hard drive. The streaks could not be removed. Would recommend looking else where for a brand new portable hard drive.

Other than that, the device works perfectly fine, so far... The speeds are really good, not having any problems with windows 10.

author: Pam Westbrook
title: Toshiba drive doesn't do what was expected
content: I purchased this hard drive to download movies from my DVR...thought I asked all the right questions of both Toshiba and DISH TV. Seemingly they both don't know that a 3 TB hard drive is not compatible until it doesn't work.  The DVR system doesn't even recognize the hard drive is in the USB port.  Very frustrating

author: M. Beard
title: Perfect match for Xbox One
content: I purchased this specifically for external storage on my Xbox One.  Following the advice of other reviewers I had the Xbox on and was logged in prior to connecting the drive.  The drive was instantly recognized and formatted very quickly.  I love that the Xbox asks if you want to use the drive as the default location for downloads and saves as part of the setup process, which I did.  Be advised that use of the drive as Xbox storage will force you to choose between using it as a game download/save location or as media drive.  You cannot store games or game saves on the drive and use it for video/music playback on the Xbox.  Not a big deal really with the low cost of these drives and the availability of multiple USB inputs on the Xbox you can have one of each and still barely have $100 invested.

author: Chipster1948
title: Just the device for storing my captured video files!
content: I am capturing and editing old video taken on  a Camcorder that produced the video for viewing with PAL television system. This hard drive is just the device to store the very large captured video.

author: James W
title: Great for storing all your PS4 games!!
content: What can I say, it does what it's supposed to do. I got it for my PS4 because I was constantly deleting games to make space for new ones and re-downloading them when I wanted to play them again. Now downloading games uses a ton of data and can sometimes take an entire day so I was tired of all that nonsense. I researched external hard drives and decided on this 2TB blue Toshiba Canvio. Now I have room for all 50+ of my games and I couldn't be happier. It does what I bought it for and 4 months later I can't think of anything negative to say about it. Setting it up to be used with my PS4 required no effort at all. I just plugged it in, the PS4 recognized it instantly, I formatted it and was all ready to store my games inside of 1 minute. Hopefully it lasts a very long time. I would absolutely recommend this hard drive to anyone looking to add more storage to their PS4. So far I have about 40 games on the hard drive and there is still roughly 500GB of memory left. So I would say that you can store an average of 50 games on the 2TB version. You get effectively 1.84TB to use and the other 0.16TB is used for system memory or something, same as when you get a phone with 32GB but there's only 28GB available. Anyway, this seems to be a great hard drive and I have zero complaints, it runs great.

author: B-More Chuck
title: - So glad I put my info on another drive before using ...
content:
Had this less than a month and it has basically stop working.Started making a clicking noise and was very very slow when transfering data (Very small data at that). So, "Buyer Beware"

P.S. -  So glad I put my info on another drive before using this one!

author: Whitney Dawn Meddings
title: Works like it should
content: Works perfectly for our PS4. We’ve had it for almost 3 months and it’s worked as expected so far. It’s easy to set up too. I’d recommend for use with a PS4.

author: H.Urig
title: Only partially compatible with Mac
content: Only semi compatible with a Mac. I reformatted it, and that went ok, but it don’t allow me to make more than one partition on it. My old Toshiba Ecternal Drive let me partition it however I wanted (it’s probably 6-7 years old) and I was looking to update. Sad, it’s not much use in a household full of only Macs. If you simple want a one partition hard drive, this would technically still work for you with Apple.

author: ZachsAllRed
title: Bare Minimum Functionality
content: Storage is fine, but we can never eject it safely except for shutting the computer down. Even when it is running, we have to restart the computer to access certain folders about one out of five times. Our last Toshiba HDD is great, so we were pretty disappointed we didn’t return this sooner.

author: Amazon Customer
title: it work for the first two days, was able ...
content: it work for the first two days, was able to transfer some of my files and now when i plug it the blue lights turns on and my laptop doesn't show in my laptops Devices or Drives....and blue light just stops... i tried my old Buffalo Hard drive it still works. Disappointing !! I think i need a refund for this.

author: Jlyn
title: I like the size of it as well
content: I'm a beginning photographer (also a momtographer) and have way too many photos on my computer so I needed somewhere safe to transfer them to so I wouldn't use up all the room on the computer itself. I don't even know how many photos and videos I have transferred onto this but it is a lot and I still have plenty of space for more. I like the size of it as well. Its not big and bulky and doesn't get in the way. I can unplug it when I'm done using it and put it in a safe spot without taking up any room.

author: PixiesMommy2018
title: Perfect for backing up your computer
content: Perfect to back up my photos, music and documents. I have over 20,000 photos, about 5,000 songs and quite a bit of word, excel and PDF documents. This is light and portable. Very fast transfer and I still have quite a bit of room to keep adding. If you’re not backing up your computer, you MUST do it!! My computer just got the black screen of death but I’m not too upset because everything is backed up on my Toshiba portable usb driver.

author: Charlotte Acha
title: Excellent Product - Cable Way too Short
content: This little guy is a fantastic replacement for my much older and slower external drive.  I have a lot on my computer and need a good and fast back up system, and this is IT.  My only complaint, and why only 4 stars?  The cable. I don't like the super short cable that comes with it. I don't connect to a laptop, but a PC, and thusly, I have to set the drive on the floor in order for the cable to reach the UBS slots.  It would have been great if they described this fact when I was looking to purchase an external hard drive, and if they gave an option to purchase with a longer cable.

author: PAT ZICARI
title: WORKS GREAT !!!
content:
GREAT for backing up Samsung phone... which is what I bought it for...
Just Format from your Cell (Android OR Apple)... works great !!

author: C. Perrin
title: Reliability problems with this hard disk!
content: This hard disk lasted a month and it died with all my data. After reading the bad reviews, I decided to replace it with a WD hard drive. Fortunately, I had three backups in total.

author: gotham
title: Great choice for Mac OS X Mavericks
content: I own 2 Toshiba drives for my PC and they have performed well, so I purchased this one for my MacBook Pro. The drive setup for the Mac was extremely smooth, and definitely exceeded my expectations. I am running Mac OS X, version 10.9.5 (Mavericks) I plugged in the Toshiba drive, opened the Mac Driver folder that came with the drive, and installed the Tuxera NTFS for Mac.dmg. The install went smoothly and within minutes I did a test backup from the MacBook to the drive. I was able to back up from the Mac and access files on the Toshiba drive with ease. Really outstanding user experience!

author: borninmo55
title: Toshiba Canvio 4TB portable drive
content: This drive works well and seems well built. Large storage capacity but the software that comes with it is very basic. I use it with Macrium Reflect instead of the Toshiba software, that's why I gave it a 4 star rating.

author: SN
title: Best I found after much research
content: All the family photos and videos, almost 2TB, are on a media PC.  I needed to back the PC to a portable drive.  After researching every portable drive I decided to get this gem because of the quality, high capacity, and low cost. I’ve used dozens of portable drives to backup photos, and this was my first Toshiba.  It has worked great.

author: José Macario
title: NO RECIBÍ EL PRODUCTO
content: Buen dia, el dia de ayer 16 de noviembre como a las 10 de la noche me enviaron un mensaje que el paquete donde venia el producto lo habían entregado, sali a buscarlo y no encontre nada, revise mi cuenta y aparecia que lo habían entregado a las 6 cosa que no es cierta, no se si se equivocaron de casa pero yo jamas recibi mi paquete, espero su respuesta y la solución a este problema, ya que he comprado otras cosas por este medio y nunca me había pasado esta situación muchas gracias, en espera de su respuesta para solucionar este inconveniente.

author: Jules Sanch
title: PS4 Extended Drive Use
content: I bought a 2TB to backup my laptop, and a 4TB to use as an extended hard drive for my PS4. Setup is really easy on both laptop and console. Regarding PS4, keep in mind if you plug this into your console and begin using it as extended hard drive, you will NOT be able to use it ALSO on your laptop because the PS4 automatically converts the hard drive to be compatible with its operating system, which is different from laptops. That’s why I got a separate one for laptop. No problems! Work great on both! Definitely worth it!

author: Robert L. Jones Jr.
title: Drive bad right out of box.
content: I used disk utilities to check proper function of drive before I started transferring files & everything checked out so I thought. About 50GB into transfer the drive started making that sickening disk drag or scraping sound. Took 3hrs 2 get my data off. Replacement being sent w/in 48hrs

author: Lawrence A Sherry
title: Good thing it has a 3 year warranty, you may need it.
content: Does not work properly after two years.  I have to return it to Toshiba for return or repair.  I have a similar Toshiba HD that I bought quite a while ago (1/2 TB).  It still is working perfectly.

author: David Levine
title: Does not work at all on my Mac. Forget about it if you use an Apple product.
content: I have a Mac Airbook. It dod not even recognize this unit I was unable to use it or format it. The blue light lights up on the external hard drive but my computer does not know it is connected. If you have a Mac, buy Seagate or something else. Toshiba should not be marketing this without clear warning. Leaves a bad taste in my mouth for Toshiba products.

author: Sharon Talbot
title: is excellent. I have used an older version of it ...
content: This drive, in and of itself, is excellent.  I have used an older version of it for many years -- until it broke.  This new drive was unable to “talk” to my MacBook Pro.  I called Toshiba and the help desk person was very kind.  He spent a long time with me trying to get the connection to work.  In the end, he mentioned that he knew Apple had made some kind of upgrade the precluded the Mac from interacting with this particular external backup.  But he did not know what it was or how to connect with it.  He hung up, after promising me he would research this.  That was three weeks ago.  I haven’t bothered to call Toshiba.  They never called me back.  Solution still in the wind.

author: Sassafras409
title: I've tested it and everything is working fine.
content: I have several Toshiba external HDs and have never had any problems with them. Until this one, they worked out of the box, but I usually use them for full back-ups. I'm using this one to store files from a Mac and a PC, so I had to install software that allows both systems to access and transfer the files, but that was included on the HD and simple to install. I've tested it and everything is working fine.

author: Karen A. Hickey
title: Months old - stopped working - Cable and connector defective
content: I just finished a huge edit of photos, working on the external drive, when it stopped working. After replugging the connector a few times, I pushed it in really hard and it finally worked. I used the time to copy everything off and it stopped working again. It's 2 weeks past the return period. This feels flimsy and both of them have had intermittent problems. One doesn't work at all with it's cable and I have to use the 2nd one, but only if really pushed in (which you shouldn't have to do). To save us from potential heartbreak we are throwing these out. And yes, fortunately I made backups.

author: DOP
title: Great 1TB storage device
content: This is a great storage device. I was looking for a device to house all my files music, picture and videos. It is sturdy on any surface and it can connect to your tv once supported by USB. The 1TB storage is quite a lot and I can definitely recommend.

author: DaveSincere
title: I needed storage and quick...
content:
I'm a photographer who NEVER deletes images.. So I know I will eventually have to invest in a RAID...  But until then drives like are perfect.  I really have no gripes with this drive.. I just wished it was a little faster..

But other than that.. the color is perfect, the size is perfect..  Worthwhile buy...

author: TammyB
title: Nice storage drive
content:
It works wonderfully as a mass storage device, I have not tested it in speed, but it works perfectly fine to stream movies from. I would have given it 5 stars except for one minor issue. It matters if your USB has enough power. My computer has USBs on the top that never had a problem powering my 1 TB hdd but could not power this hdd. It would show that it was connected to my computer but I could not access or use it in any way (Windows 10) It wasn't until I plugged it into a USB on the front that went straight to a USB header on my motherboard that it had enough power to light it up. Once that was done, it worked flawlessly. If you are having problems you may need to hook it up to a powered USB hub, but it is a good drive.

It is also a little thicker than I expected, almost twice the thickness of my 1TB drive, but it is still a very portable drive.

author: Traveler
title: No excuse not to backup your files
content: Works perfectly.  Backups are easy.

author: M. Conant
title: Storage Capacity
content: I love that this portable drive holds 4 Terabytes.  I take a lot of photos and need reliable and large capacity in a storage unit and this one fills the need.  I have found that the Toshiba brand of hard drives is more reliable and our lasts other brands.  This is my second Toshiba and my fourth overall portable hard drive.  I have not used technical support therefore I did not review that feature.

author: Ravi Teja Neelipally
title: Best value for money in the market compared to others.
content: Small, looks good and very handy. The write and reading speeds are also good. It has been 6 months and everything is smooth till now.

author: CR
title: Great product
content: Finally switched from usb's to this external hard drive and it has done wonders. I throw saved emails, pictures and other data on it and in matter of seconds it transfers. Using it is very easy, all you do is plug in the usb to your computer and the drive will show under my computer. Drag and drop your intended file onto the the drive and viola! Very simple and easy to use, will definitely make your life a little easier.

author: DJ
title: Great storage in a small package
content: Unit as promised. The tech support could be better. You will need to be a little savvy to deal with it.

author: Exxactly This Princesa
title: I absolutely love this EHD
content:
Toshiba Canvio Connect II 2TB Portable Hard Drive, Black(HDTC820XK3C1)
I absolutely love this EHD. I have had several over the years but they have been other brands. I decided to give this one a try. My other brands crashed within a matter of months and lost so much of my data. So far so good with this external and super happy about the warranty. Great on time shipping

author: Steve Spigarelli
title: Less than 2 years - not worth it. Make sure you have a second backup if this is your backup drive
content: Worked fine for 2 less than two years. I'll buy something more reliable in the future. This disk was used as a backup drive only and is completely borked now with the heads clicking in the drive with no abuse.

author: AK
title: Great capacity for price
content: It is super easy to use. Just plug it. Super capacity and portable. Colors are different as regulars. I haven't used the tech support. It does not have antislip under it as my old ones.

author: Birdman
title: But Toshiba drives have about the best reputation on the market for reliability
content: This drive is quite a bit thicker than I expected.  It's one of the larger portable drives I have purchased, exceeded in size only by the LaCie "Rugged" series.  But Toshiba drives have about the best reputation on the market for reliability, so that drove my choice.

author: CrazyBroad
title: Died after a few months
content: This was placed on a desk and NOT MOVED, yet died in a matter of month. I was using this as a backup to a backup, so not being able to retrieve the data is not an issue, but what a waste of money.

author: Connie
title: Great for storage and file transfer
content: I upgraded my MacBook Pro and my file transfer software no longer worked. I needed something so I could transfer files between my Mac loptop and my PC desktop. This has worked well. I started it first on the MacBook, then once I had the files on there hooked it up to my desktop and moved them to the desktop. It will be a backup as well, since the solid state drive on my laptop is not as large as my old hard drive.

author: rowdygang
title: So easy to use
content: This is my 3rd Canvio Drive and I haven't had any problems so far.  I use them to back up pictures from my photography business.

author: Rafael
title: Works great on both Windows 7, 8 & 10
content:
I bought this hard drive to back up my Windows 7 laptop and do a factory reset because it was having some issues.
It amazes me how much files this thing can hold. I have stored thousands of pictures, songs, videos, college homework, etc.

Below I will list some pros and cons I found while using this hard drive:

Pros
-Small
-I will have enough memory for years and years of pictures and documents.
-Easy to operate just like a regular USB flash drive.
-Great for backing up your files
-Works with Windows 7, 8 & 10 (only three systems I've tried it on)

Cons
-Haven't found any problems with the product but will gladly update my review if I do.

Overall, I recommend this product to anyone looking for a hard drive. It's a good idea to keep a backup of your memories and important documents in case your computer ever breaks.

author: tomcatrebel
title: CHEAP PRICE AND AN INCREDIBLE BARGAIN
content: This is my 2nd Toshiba External drive. I paid less than what Any stores around me would charge. All I had to do is plug in the USB cord to the computer. The drive was instantly recognized and I started transferring files from my computer within 5 minutes. Also, this drive is super FAST.

author: Shannon Coty
title: GREAT FOR ON THE GO STUDENT
content: It works great! It does feel a little cheaper than other brands I've had, so I'm not entirely sure how durable it is. Not going to risk drop testing it lol but other than the feel of it, the functionality is exactly what I wanted. I got the red color and it's a beautiful cherry red, very pretty. It's super light weight and portable, it fits in my purse comfortably along with my wallet, phone, keys, and miscellaneous items. Would buy again or for a friend 👍🏻

author: NBAstien
title: Not good for Xbox One
content: I got this product for my Xbox One after doing research which highly recommended this one. It works great to hold games on the device for extra storage. The downside is that if I was playing a game that was on the external hard drive, my Xbox would turn off and restart often. If you are looking for an external Xbox hard drive, I would guess that ones that connect directly to the system without a cord would be best. Overall, it is a great external hard drive, but not the best for Xbox.

author: Jerry P. Danzig
title: TB or not TB
content:
After I got fed up with all the error messages I would receive using Windows 7 Backup and a 150gb Iomega portable drive, I thought I would see how much a new outboard drive would cost me.  The hard drive on my hard-working Toshiba Satellite laptop is 500gb.

Lo and behold -- a person can now get a terabyte drive for under sixty dollars!  Where do I sign up???

At any rate, I haven't lived long with this nifty Toshiba Canvio Connect II, but so far so good.  In my experience, Toshiba makes bullet-proof computing equipment.

The unit itself is just slightly larger than a pack of cards and has a handsome glossy surface.  Two lights inside flash when the drive is doing its thing, and the machine uses just one USB cable for interface and power (the Iomega used two -- how quaint!)

The NTI Backup Now EZ4 software provided seems to work very well.  It automatically schedules a daily backup of files and folders and a monthly backup of system files.  It offers the option of backing up to a cloud drive somewhere as well, but I haven't used this for fear of hacking issues.

So far, no error messages or other problems of any kind -- what a relief!

Folks looking for a capable TB hardware and software backup solution at a very reasonable price need look no further...  I'll report back if I have any reasons to change my opinion.

author: Trevor Hedden
title: 3 TB is a LOT of room for storage
content: Before this item I owned the 1 TB Toshiba model and was quite happy with it. Time passed and I wondered how much it would be to get another 1 TB drive for backing up everything. Searching Amazon, I found the 3 TB Toshiba drive (this item) to be very affordable and got it. Now I have backup digital storage for everything I could ever need - past, present and for the foreseeable future as well.

author: lilacbluestone
title: Should have listened to other reviewers
content: Toshiba customer service was terrible! She just didn't care and wanted to get me off the line as fast as possible. (And I'm a charming person, lol.) Tried going through Amazon tech to fix - much nicer - but couldn't help either. Just couldn't get device to schedule a backup. Perhaps it's a problem only common to certain PCS with certain OS's? That could explain why it works so well for other folks. Gave up. Returning.

author: Fernando
title: Large storage capacity, but slow
content: The size, look and feel of the drive is excellent. Small and portable. 2TB of storage at a great price. I use it for my Time Machine and I'm surprised it's that slow. I expected it to be faster. I might get a usbc cable to see if that improves speed.

author: Daniel V. Novatnak
title: You want portable? You want this!
content: Toshiba drives are lightweight in all capacities. Solid performance and a great value to boot. I can't say enough good things.

author: cavaliersam
title: Great hard drive and deal
content: Best deal for 2TB hard drive.  Had my other Toshiba for years and was rough with it and it never stopped working well

author: DameEdna
title: worth it
content: took a while for my computer to download all the drivers and set it up but it's just what I needed.  my old drive is, well, old.  plenty of room here to back up all of my files from that and all the ones on every other storage device I own.

author: Gambler
title: Works great with my Dish Network Hopper DVR
content: Was $40 when I bought it and worked perfectly with my Dish Network DVR.  I don't know why I didn't get one sooner!  Note that it takes a LONG time to download all your movies.  This isn't a criticism just information.  I had about 300 GB and it took all night and part of the next morning.

author: Lee Gillette
title: Absolutely no complaints with Toshiba
content: The only thing I would be leery about is the security software that comes with it.  I never install it or use it because when I bought a Western Digital portable hard drive, the software locked me out after I had forgotten the password, telling me I had to sign in with the old password to change to a new password.  I know, it makes no sense.  The only thing I know for sure is that it wasn't Toshiba.  Never had a problem with them. Enough said?

author: David A. Schultz
title: Great little USB-powered drive.
content:
I would've made it a 5-star, except for it powers down when not access enough. Kind of irritating, but I guess not without reason seeing as it is USB-powered.  If it were not USB-powered, I would've rated it 3 stars.  I want to decide if spinning down is necessary.

Still, 4TB for a scratch drive and not high-use makes the spinning down bearable.

author: Shilo
title: great
content: I have purchased two of them now

author: Michael Case
title: Great backup drive
content: Love this thing so far.  The 4TB capacity is more than enough to backup all my files.  My initial backup was about 1.5 TBs and it went by super fast (I should have timed it but is was less than 20 minutes) which is much faster than my older drive.  The case is small but sturdy and there's a nice obvious blue LED that lets you know its busy (I have an earlier backup drive I used with a barely visible activity LED that annoyed the heck out of me).  Very happy and a great Prime Day deal.

author: WildFire18
title: Perfect PS4 Upgrade!
content: Instead of buying a brand new 1TB PS4 I decided to grab one of these puppies and upgrade my ps4 for a fraction of the price! Super easy! Just plug in to the left usb port, play with your settings a little on the ps4 itself so it saves to the external drive and bam! Only downfall is you loose a usb port so it makes charging things and using a wireless mic a little more difficult. You're smart though... you'll figure it out ;).

author: JP
title: Great for backups
content: Just plug it into a USB 2 or 3 outlet and turn your computer on.  It will bring up the included software which is easy to install.  You can choose to back up to the cloud, or you can do just a file (work file) backup, or back up your whole machine.  That was I chose to do and it was easy to complete; although it it hard to see where the files were placed due to the addresses used.  But, the data seems to be there.  Lucky, have not had to use the restore function.  Think I will buy a second one.  One for my laptop and one for my wife's.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Accompanying software not the best
content: So far the backups workwell.  But I was informed by Toshiba tech support that it won't back up any attached hard drives or flash drives, which defeats the entire reason I bought this hard drive, as my main hard drive on my computer  is pretty small. Also, each time you change your backup plan it deletes your old backup. so that doesn't work long term unless you never change your folder structure.  I will just use it for copying and pasting my files.  Not as efficient I suppose, but it's ok.

author: Steve Pickering
title: This unit is very usable for someone who carries it often
content:
Have been very pleased with this device - it is small, easy to use (just plug in), easy to handle, and easy to carry.

The round corners make it so much easier to carry and handle.  It seems like a mundane feature, but if you carry the drive with you in a backpack or briefcase, usability becomes an issue with all the square-cornered drives.  Also, if you drop this drive, the round corners are less jarring and less likely to harm the disk.

author: John Schubert
title: Works like a champ on XBOX One
content: Pulled it out of the box and connected to an XBOX One.  It wasn't recognized, so I detached and reattached the drive.  It asked if this was for game storage, or photos/videos/files.  I selected game storage and the XBOX immediately went from 99% full to about 25%.  I've been using it for about a week now and it is perfect for expanding the storage on my console.  I installed an old Call of Duty (Black Ops 1) and another title from disc, and it's been seamless.  This drive was rated by a magazine as a "Best Bang for the Buck" to expand the storage on an XBOX ONE, and I would 100% agree.  It isn't loud, doesn't get hot, and you'd never know it was there.  Great solution.

author: Andy
title: Great Value, solid performance.
content: I have been using this thing for a year now and it works great. It was easy to set up and has been easy to use. I keep important documents on it and wanted to make sure it would be reliable.  I am happy to report that I have had no problems and it was a good price. Toshiba have a solid product here. I'm now interested in a larger storage model and wouldn't hesitate to purchase again from Toshiba.

author: Tampadoc
title: Back-up NOW or cry about lost data LATER
content:
I use the Toshiba 1TB Portable HD to back up two MacBook Pros and am quite pleased with its functionality with Apple's Time Machine back-up system. Set-up is very easy. To use, simply connect the included USB 3.0 cable (back-compatible with USB 2.0 computers) to your computer. With the Apple Time Machine, all you need to do is select "Back Up Now" from the drop down menu and your computer will be backed up (sometimes the "Preparing to Back-up" step seems to take forever but the back-up does occur). If you wish to simply back up individual files, you would "drag and drop" the files into the Toshiba icon on your desktop. (Reviews: JK on September 16, describes how to set up this portable drive (Thank you, JK) and is worth reading).
P.S. I also owned a LaCie 500GB USB 2.0 portable HD which failed after 23 months of use but a replacement was sent under LaCie's 2 year warranty. I read one tech review re: back-ups and the author, probably more obsessive than I, used 4 or 5 devices (!) to back-up his data. After my  wife lost important emails, she did simple document back-ups, not entire system back-ups, I purchased the Toshiba so that she and I could have redundancy by using two distinct portable hard drives. Time Machine and the two portable HDs allow this to occur without any difficulty - just plug in the drive and perform the back-up

author: Damion
title: Lasted 5 weeks
content:
I bought this drive for my PS4 and only play a couple times a week due to work schedule. It sat in one spot, unmoved, in a well-ventilated area. I went to play last night and the drive was making a grinding noise when it started up and did not work anymore.

Of course, when I logged in to Amazon, it said it is past the return date...by 1 week..
Luckily I was only using this for a game system and not for business critical backup. The price was good at $60, but not when it only lasts for a month of very light use.

author: Alchemist
title: Upgrade from using USB
content: I was still using Usb 2.0 at the time of purchase. The more capacity on Usb stick, the longer it takes to put information on. So I upgrade from using Usb to this 1 Tb hard drive that easily fit into my pockets. The little guy runs cool, quiet, and doesn't require a separate power source as some others do. It has software included but I don't use it.  This hard drive supports both Usb 2.0 and 3.0, the light blinks white during data transfer connected to a PC using 2.0 and blue for 3.0(Works with Windows 7, 8 & 10).  Still works after all this time.

author: MGZTRUTHFUL
title: QUALITY RELIABLE
content: After researching on Toshiba's external Hard drives it truly is one of the highest quality reliable HD out there, I'm so glad I did not buy another Porsche/Lacie...Thank You Toshiba...All The Best

author: judy
title: No problems - easy to use
content: I only use this for important files that I want to manually backup to keep in readable form for myself and family to access easily.  I have other Toshiba hard drives with more storage for complete computer backups.  Very easy to use.  The only thing I don't like is that when connected to my laptop, the backup software automatically starts and I have to remember to cancel the backups.

author: Jeanne Good
title: So far so good...
content:
I had a 1 terabyte Toshiba usb external hard drive before I bought this 2 terabyte. Both had served me well without any problems...so far. I've only had the 2 terabyte since Christmas so its long term use is still to be determined, but so far, it functions fine. No complaints.

have a good day everyone. :).

author: Deborah K. Wright
title: Do NOT trust this piece of equipment!
content: Do NOT trust this piece of equipment.  I moved all of my office data over to this drive and after a week of it working great, I deleted all of my data from my desktop.  The very next day, I couldn't access the data on this external drive.  It had to be taken to a Data company to have my data retrieved.  This wasn't a software issue bur a hardware issue.  Something had broken/gone wrong inside.  This drive was so new that they had to order parts to fix it in order for them to be able to deconstruct and reconstruct my data.  It ended up costing me $2,200.00 to have my data retrieved.  I realized that I was stupid for not having a 3rd backup service but shame on me for trusting this piece of equipment.  My IT guy said things like this happen but who would want to take the chance?  I have been a faithful customer of Amazon since they opened their 'virtual' doors so I called customer service.  The young lady was very nice and after explaining the issues and what it had cost me, she commented that she would go see what Amazon could do for me.  She came back and offered me a $20.00 credit on my Amazon account.  At this point I let her know that she was insulting me, told her good-bye and hung up the phone.  Talk about leaving a 'bad' taste in my mouth, this sure did.  BTW, Amazon did refund my cost for the drive ($99,.00).

author: Eric U.
title: Photographer usage.
content:
Works great, quick speeds. I use it for photo and video storage and a second one for backups. .jpeg, RAW, .psd, .TIFF .mov and .mp4 formats.
nice small portable size, colors make it easy to distinguish which is the working drive and which is the back up. Would not hesitate to purchase again

author: M. Bean
title: Worked for 13 days
content: This drive worked for 13 days. This is the second flaky Toshiba drive I've owned, and it'll be the last.

author: Doug Of Los Angeles
title: Seems Reliable & Nice Size
content: I use it as an external drive for videos through my PS4.  Works great.  I use MP4 videos that I load through MacBook Air.  Then I plug it into PS4. They have the be encoded to particular specifications and the drive needs to have a couple folders that need to be done (Google it) but it works beautifully.  Who knows how long it will last.  I’m highly skeptical of the reliability of any external drive but after a couple months I’ve not seen any hints of problems.  I’ll update this review if it ever fails on me but so far so good.

author: D. W.
title: Internal Connector failed after 10 unplugs
content: This product is a piece of junk.  The internal connector failed after plugging and unplugging it only about 10 times.  I expected so much better from Toshiba but what a disappointment.  Then I called to get warranty service and they tell me "sometime the connector is not covered under warranty".  What??? Are you kidding me???  What good is a warranty that is a lie?  Will never buy Toshiba again . . .

author: JOK says
title: Great for movies and TV shows
content: Simple, portable external hard drive perfect for saving files/pictures/movies in a separate, but convenient location.  The included USB cable connects easily to any desktop or laptop for saving and playback and won't clog up or slow down your device.  This device doesn't come with any extra messy software or applications like some similar products, and is as easy as saving files to/from any other folder on your computer.  Device is ready to use as is, and has been perfect for storing movies and TV shows for watching across multiple computers or TVs with a USB input.  The 1TB size accommodates about a dozen full length movies and close to 100 hour-long tv shows.

author: JelloManJohnny
title: Slowed to a halt - read / write super slow
content: Not sure what the issue is.  Have done enough to get it working but the product read / write speed just slowed unreasonably.  I would avoid this product.  Too many bad reviews.

author: Ant Farmer
title: Good, just wish it had a power switch.
content: No problems with this 3 TB hard drive. Formatted it for Mac and use it for time machine backups without problems. Wish it just had an on-off switch so it could be left connected after powering down the computer... keeps spinning and need to disconnect the cord. But that is the same problem with almost all external drives these days, they are just to cheap to include an OFF switch.

author: Leslie F. Hartness
title: Love this, and a great price!
content:
I have been using a 2TB version of this unit for a few years now, and never had any problems with it.  Being a photographer and videographer, I generate a lot of large files, and need plenty of storage.  The 2TB is full, so I got the 3TB for the same price that the 2TB went for a couple years ago.  I love how technology lowers it's prices as it marches along.

First thing I do when I hook it up is delete everything on it, formatting the drive so that I can use every bit of space for MY folders.  Then, just use it as an additional hard drive.  Simplicity at it's finest.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Needs a workaround for MAC users!
content: Works lie it should I have been a MAC guy for many years.  Nothing in the documentation said it was pre-formatted NTFS (Windows).  It comes with a "special software" that lets the MAC operating system write to it.  Can't reformat it in the MAC since it involves writing to the drive.  So I installed their software and then reformatted it using Disk Utility.  Hokey system.  Should have come formatter in FAT and let users reformat it directly in their operating system's file system.

author: Jonathan Leone
title: Faulty Drive
content:
Unfortunately I was sent a faulty drive. After filling it about 25% of capacity, it will become completely inaccessible and slow down or nearly lock up my computer.
After research and extensive work around just to be able to access the drive without it affecting the rest of my computer I ultimately had to format and lose all data on it.
In my research I found what could cause such behavior and aimed to try a few more times to verify it was not user error on my part. After the third time of the drive becoming unusable at a similar point with proper, safe use, I realized it was a reproduce-able fault that must originate from the drive itself having read instability.

Troubleshooting myself in this way took me beyond my return window for the product, so by trying to save the faulty drive I was sent, I wasted my money on something that is ultimately useless beyond the 400GB~500GB mark, which should hold 2TB.

Sadly I can not recommend Toshiba Storage solutions because of this, and will be looking to other, more reliable drives by other companies in the future.

author: Micheal R. Schlicht
title: Great portable drive!
content: This portable drive works great, plenty of storage, and has a reasonable price!

author: Allen J
title: HANDY TO HAVE AROUND THE HOME OFFICE AND ON TRIPS.
content: This is a great portable external hard drive. I believe in backing up any computer files you want to keep ——- you never know when your internal hard drive is going to crash. The hard drive is convenient to use and the size is perfect for your computer bag, purse, camera case or even your pocket. I highly recommend picking one up for peace of mind.

author: chiseptum
title: Small footprint quality hard drive
content: This external hard drive has exceeded my expectations in many ways. From the small size, high data speeds via USB 3.0, quiet operation, low operating temperature, and very small footprint. It is crazy to realize how small a physical hard drive, that is capable of holding 2 TB of data, can actually be. I took an old, over 8 years old, 1 TB USB 2.0 external hard drive and copied it over to this new hard drive; it handled it just perfectly. Since I am using this hard driver for a LINUX based OS I had to change the formatting of the drive to FAT32 and did not encounter any issues. This hard drive also will spin down in a timely fashion both saving energy and increasing the life of the hard drive itself. I would highly recommend this external hard drive for anyone who is looking for a small footprint external hard driver that operates at a very reasonable temperature.

author: Derek
title: Very fast and easy to use
content: Very fast and easy to use. I get why these devices come with pre-installed software, but to me it is a waste of storage space. It doesn't add anything in terms of protection that I can tell and it can function without it like a flash drive does.

author: George
title: Very confusing instructions
content: The instructions are not very clear. Once you realize that the software that they tell you must be downloaded is for a cloud service, the item itself is good. I called the customer service at Toshiba, and the first person was useless; the second had me send back the first purchase as he told me my unit was defective as it took hours to download the unneeded software; while the third was excellent and told me that I did not need the software and it was all set to go. I followed her instructions, and this unit works fine.

author: Dex
title: Good purchase
content: Great little hard drive. Love it

author: Anjiso
title: Small and powerd off the USB connection itself.
content:
The Toshiba external hard drive is much smaller than I expected which I like. Unlike some other external USB drive, this drive is powered off the USB port itself; therefore, no separate external power supply. This means you do not have to worry about a losing a power supply module.
I bought this drive to replace my existing Seagate drive. The Seagate drive does not connect to my laptop reliably. The problem is a bad USB connection at the Seagate drive. If I hold the USB connector at certain position, the driver connects to the laptop and it disconnects if I release holding it. USB ports are designed such that the cable side  connector has the parts that wear fast. So, if you have a connection problem, the problem is likely due to damaged cable. Based on this assumption, I had bought a new cable for the Seagate drive; however, the new cable did not solve the problem and I ended up buying the Tohsiba driver. Surprisingly, the Seagate drive connects with no problem when I use the USB cable that came with the Toshiba drive. It means the cable that came with the Toshiba drive is a better cable. I decided to keep the Tishiba drive and now I have two backup drives, which is a good thing. Note: to get the faster read and write speed, the cable and USB port on the PC must support USB 3.0. USB 3.0 is indicated by the blue plastic bar inside the port.

author: Brent Thompson
title: Piece of junk with bad software
content:
Piece of junk with bad software. As it appears has happened to others, the drive failed completely after less than 2 months of use. The computer no longer recognizes it, and it runs constantly without actually working.

There is no redeeming value in this drive. It is cheaply made and feels like it could have come from a dollar store. The USB cord easily falls out of the drive, which tanks the backup.

The software is poorly developed and certainly doesn’t make one feel that data is safe. It does not offer continuous backup and is basic.

I tried this brand after being dissatisfied with another one, only to find that it’s worse. Of course the drive failed 2 weeks after the return window closed. Adios, 70 bucks.

author: Harleyman58
title: Small and reliable
content: Easy to set up and works great with our Apple devices

author: Phanessa
title: Not working after 4 months
content:
Update (4 months later): it no longer works. I cannot open it on 2 MacBooks and a PC, tried different cords too. Not sure what’s wrong :(

I couldn’t decide wihich storage size to get. I wanted the most (4TB+) but I also wanted a small/slim drive. I decided to go with the smaller one for size and portability. It was the right size and connected to my MacBook with no issues. You can set password for privacy.

author: george barry
title: works great as an external OS-X backup disk
content: hard to believe the footprint of this 1TB external disk. works great as an external OS-X backup disk. Not using any backup software just copy/paste.

author: Fern
title: Beautiful and trustworthy
content:
I have many portable HD. I have various WD. I was afraid of buying a Toshiba. I have to tell that I'm very happy with it. Considering the price range is more affordable it is really a nice choice. You can trust it.
I've been using for the last 7 months continuously without any problem. It is light, pretty and functional. No problme with speed.

author: dude
title: So far so good
content: Like the white one.. Matches my wii. Was a good deal. I left it formatted NTSC, and works great for the wii.  Only problem is the hard drive does go to sleep after a while. I noticed that when downloading covers for my games... I have to dl them one by one because the wii does freeze afte a while (prob cuz the hdd isn't being accessed) Seems to work ok tho so far. I take 1 star away cuz it goes to sleep... Maybe I'm being harsh...

author: C Señor
title: Had some trouble initializing it for Mac at first but ...
content: Had some trouble initializing it for Mac at first but eventually I was able to clear that hurdle.  Since then I've been very impressed with the reliability of this drive.  It also has a much faster transfer rate than I was expecting from a basic USB connection.

author: KT
title: This was easy to set up and compatible with my MAC
content: This is my new back up hard drive since my last one (of a different brand) failed while updating my MAC. This was easy to set up and compatible with my MAC. It is very user friendly, and I will likely purchase a second for for another backup. 2 TB is a great size for my needs. It is quiet, and does not have a separate power source other than the usb drive. It is just as expected, and I am quite happy with this purchase.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Don't buy this product!
content: This hard drive worked for two days and then would not work.  I downloaded many critical files on this hard drive during those two days and now it does not function.  Best Buy wants $100 to attempt to extract the files but said that it might likely cost more.  Toshiba said that I could return the unit for another one but would not help me extract my critical files.  I am not sending this hard drive to Toshiba for a return with personal files stored on it.  Don't buy it! A nightmare!

author: TAE L.
title: Bad Micro-B connection. Keeps unmounting.
content: I bought this to back up my MacBook Pro in my recent upgrade HD to an SSD. The hard drive is fine as long as you don't touch it while it's connected to the computer. The slightest movement will disconnect and eject the hard drive. Most likely it's a bad connection on the micro-B to the hard drive. I never had this issue with WD Passport which has a micro-B connector as well. I wish I can get a refund but I have my backup from my old HD.

author: rkruz
title: Nice substantial metal cased drive with cable
content: The Toshiba Canvio External Hard Drive  much nicer drive then the slightly lower priced Seagate version.  The Toshiba has a nice metal case makes it feel sturdy and substantial.  The Toshiba activity light is large and easy to see.  Most importantly it worked perfectly with no fuss with my laptop both from using USB power to providing fast USB 3.0 data rates..  It was recognized instantly from a Dell 5000 series laptop using Windows 10.  It is being used as a backup drive with Acronis software to regularly back up.  The drive has accepted several automated or unattended backups with no issue what-so-ever.  The red case is great as it is attractive and stands out from the dreary black other electronics usually comes in..  I could not see in the webpage that a cable was supplied but now I can confirm it is supplied with a USB cable.

author: Sunny Rush
title: Easy to use - Great purchase for price
content: Hey, I needed some extra space because I design digital scrapbooking graphics.  I was tired of always pushing my stuff to an expensive cloud, one I had to renew subscriptions for year after year.  Now I have secure storage at 2T, and it's easy to manage.  I am very happy with my purchase.

author: Landru
title: No Power Cable Required!
content: Last USB powered backup drive I bought was when only 1TB's were available without an external power supply (wall wart).  Plugged it in and instantly started working by assigning itself the next available drive letter and was up and running in seconds.  Very fast USB 3.0 interface and very pleased with it.  (I didn't use subcategory Tech Support, so I gave them 5 stars for not having to be used!)

author: Kindle Customer
title: Appears to work
content: It appears to work but you cannot review the back up files, unless you drag and drop. So I do the automatic backup, with faith it is working then the really important files I drag and drop so I know they are there.

author: Hermilanes
title: New and original
content:
Excellent performance, well built, fast and easy.
No problem at all and is the second one for me.
Good price.
First class material.
Recommended 100%

author: Rodriguez
title: SOLID BUY
content: I use this for all my storage needs since my PC onlyhas a 240GB hard drive. I have had absolutely no issues with this at all! I’ve installed about 10 games on it and also store huge media and program files to it and haven’t even broke 3/4’s of it yet. I have yet to sense it over heat, even after playing games installed directly to it for a few hours. Applications/Programs/Games/media...whatever storage needs you have. This will do just fine. Just keep in mind the GB size and Taylor to your needs.1TB suits me perfectly.

author: Scott B
title: Perfect PS4 extra storage
content: This is perfect for my PS4 expandable storage!  Works great, is compact, have had zero lag or outbound using it.  Set up was quick and super easy.  Was exactly what I wanted.

author: R&B90
title: Not What It Seems.
content: I have had this for almost a year.  The connector cable came off and now it disconnects from the hard drive all the time. AND now it seems my computers are having a hard time recognizing the drive.  Lots of space to backup, but if it doesn’t last, then what?  I back up my work files daily so it’s extremely important that I have a good functioning hard drive.

author: WildThing
title: It no longer works
content: It worked great ... until while working today, it just up & became unreadable. I have 3 different Virus protection programs so it wasn't that as each scan said the product had no issues .... how a device could just up and die like this is unbelieveable. Now I have work that I haven't had a chance to upload to the cloud lost forever. I'm going back to the smaller USB jump drives .... Oh & yes, there was more than enough room left on the device.

author: Rivers Books
title: One of the Best
content: I purchased one 10 years ago and it is still going strong. I purchased a second one with more capacity and USB 3. Overall a great product.

author: jr2012
title: Excellent product as all Toshiba Canvio External Hard Drives
content:
Excellent quick and durable external hard drive. Pros: USB 3.0 port, it's a Toshiba Canvio, and I've been purchasing this brand for years on Amazon (More than 10 of them) and I've never had any issue with any of the purchases, that, why I prefer this brand.  This is the first or 2T capacity, and it's working fine since day one.
CONS: None,.

author: Papoo Tech
title: Excellent 2TB HDD
content: Excellent (2TB version). Outwardly looks good with solid feel. Colours are good and easy to see which is which. I reformatted it without problems for a Mac. I transferred about 1GB of Time Machine backups and then started using it as a new backup. I like the light on top which is white for USB2.0 and blue for USB3.0. So far the hard drive is performing exactly as specified. If it fails I will update the review.

author: robert lewallen
title: Works well
content: Works well I need to get another one for picture storage. Would be nice if you could go straight from your smart phone into it.

author: Romoalej
title: Toshiba Canvio Advance
content: Me es muy útil para efectuar los back up de las tarjetas de memorias y volver a utilizarlas como así trasladas información

author: Mens Sana
title: If you are going to move it around, you'll need to keep the cable handy
content:
USB 3.0 A to Micro B (Canvio end) cable included.  Not every buyer will have a Micro B cable handy.  I do and moving the Canvio from room to room was easy without hauling the cable along.

I use the Canvio mostly from storing recorded TV programs.  The USB 3 read/writes are quite speedy.  I have not yet tried to use the included applications and have not had the drive long enough to attest to durability.  I like the drive!
